After a long flight this hotel is amazing for a big sleep!The fitness facilities are great too if you want some down time. They are equipped with a gym, sauna, spa and pool.The staff were lovely too.Overall I was very pleasantly surprised by the standards of this hotel. It was truly 5-star, and I would recommend it to anyone staying in Tokyo.

My wife and I spent 5 days at the Cerulean in January. The hotel was everything I could have hoped for: a convenient location, large beautifully decorated room (loved the toilet), endlessly fascinating view (34th floor) out over Tokyo, great staff. We were on the Club level and enjoyed meals, drinks and the view repeatedly throughout the day--it you can do this, it's more than worth it. There have been so many positive reviews of this hotel, so just a few additional thoughts. First, the location was excellent for a Tokyo novice. The Cerulean is quite central, near the Shibuya railroad and subway station and an interesting walk to many sights and shopping districts.Strange to say but the hotel's distinctive shape and height were also really helpful and made it easier to find in the mass of people, cars and multi-level/multi-dimensional movement at Shibuya street level.We loved the muted, cloth and wood decor. It was, well, soothing after a day out in Tokyo.Finally, the hotel staff were wonderful and helpful in so many ways. They created a warm and welcoming feel in this large, modern hotel.

This is our second time staying at this hotel. The location is good as it's walking distance to Shibuya Station, Mark City shopping, Tokyu dept. store and 7 min walk to the famous Shibuya Crossing. The view from the room is incredible as you can see most of Tokyo city and on a clear day, Mt Fuji. The room is very spacious and shower pressure is great!Will definitely stay here again in the future.

We’ve been staying in this hotel every time we come to Tokyo. The location is very convenient and the room are spacious. The service standard is amazing, even for Japanese standard. Their concierge service is second to none. Naoko Sugita san went out of her way to help us with bookings and recommendations. True spirits of Omotenashi! We’ll definitely be coming back again and can’t recommend this hotel enough.

We couldn't book the hotel a couple of days before NYE and on NYE so had to book it when we got back to Tokyo.This was our second time at the hotel and it didn't disappoint. Thank you for upgrading our room. It was a nice surprise :)The hotel is in great condition and a fantastic location. We had a decent size room on the executive level with great city views.It is also good to see that they are making guest aware of the fitness centre charges and how you can avoid the charges if you join the members program, which I joined last year. I think the hotel should continue to communicate this based on other reviews. It is something us Westerners (incl. Asian Westerners) are not used to. The staff were very helpful and spoke good English. However, I am also conscious, I as tourist should also attempt to speak the local language to fully immerse myself in the culture.It looks like Japan will be an annual trip and Cerulean might be our home in Tokyo while away from home!!!Arigato!

One of the best hotels I have stayed at. The location being so close to Shibuya was fantastic. The rooms in the hotel are some of the nicest I've stayed in. We stayed in a Deluxe Queen room and it was well worth it. The bed was HUGE. It almost felt like 2 Queen size bed's pushed together. Had some of the best sleep I've ever had in this bed. Pillows were nice and soft as well.Bathroom was excellent. Toilet was just as I'd expect a Japan toilet would be (First time with warmed toilet seats!).Could not fault anything about the room (except maybe the size of the TV.... such a nice big room... yet the TV was small by comparison).The only negative was the cost of some things within the hotel itself. That was our fault though. For instance... the bar on the top floor was expensive. You can't go up there and not have a drink and some nibbles to go with the view, but the prices were exorbitant. The worst though was in the lobby. We sat down to have 2 coffees and were absolutely shocked at the price. Over 2,700 Yen (Almost $35 Australian) for 2 small cups of coffee is an absolute rip off. If we had seen a menu before walking in and being seated we would never have gone in, in the first place. No restaurant not matter how "classy" it is can justify coffee at that price.

A great location near everything that Shibuya has to offer. Lovely rooms and friendly staff. The breakfast is pretty ordinary so if that isnt included in your price I would dine elsewhere. Other restaurants and bars are very good

I had really high expectations for this hotel and it definitely delivered. It is super close to Shibuya station, but far away enough so that you avoid the unpleasantness that comes with it. The staff are very helpful, friendly and professional. The rooms are spacious and have incredible views of Mount Fuji. The amenities are plentiful and the beds are very comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Great arrival and check in. Had amazing view of Tokyo tower and Mt Fuji. Was beautiful to wake up to. The room did smell slightly of smoke, in a non smoking room which I don’t like as I am asthmatic. The facilities were out of service for 2 weeks which was disappointing & a reason I chose the hotel ... and I had to pay $30AUD to use a VERY small gym. The buffet breakfast was good, the room service choices weren’t amazing. Stayed a few nights for work, haven’t been to Tokyo in 3 years and forgot the rules for the sake of rules & this place has it in spades. Sitting in the lobby lounge - all people at table must place an order...want to sit at a particular table with less ppl than chairs, it cannot happen. Very frustrating not getting flexibility to please customers.

Very attentive and friendly staff, spacious room and super comfortable bed. Really enjoyed the views from the 26th floor. Rooms were kept clean and location's very good, only a short walk to Shibuya station. All in all a 5 star experience, although I do not understand why they don't provide complimentary coffee/tea in the rooms, as every hotel in Japan does so. Felt a bit silly to pay 400¥ for a teabag in a luxury hotel like this.

For service and hotel ambiance definetly it was the best in Shibuya ,but you need to walk at lease 600 m from and to main attraction in the area The Shibuya Crossing Intersection and Hachiko Statue.The staff was well trained and speak english fluently.

We found the hotel compared well with the likes of other luxury hotels such as The Capitol; in fact we feel this hotel provides better value for money! One great feature is access to the Airport Limousine Bus service. The Limousine Bus calls into the hotel and this makes for easy bag handling. The hotel is also very close to the South exit of Shibuya Rail Station. There are plenty of dining options close to the hotel.

We checked in a couple of days ahead of NYE and I immediately felt (for reasons which will take up too much space) that the check-in counter staff weren't as warm and helpful as we had experienced in Japan. We were given a room on the 24th floor (rooms start from 19th floor) which had a decent enough view (city view of Skytree, Tokyo Tower etc) but I would have liked for us to have been higher given how people rave about the views from the higher floors. My husband went downstairs to see if they could change our room and after some persuading, they moved us to the 31st floor- this was good of them and I did appreciate this. We went to the Bellevisto bar on the first night and it was great and the drinks are very well made- views are outstanding too. The second night we went back and my husband asked if we could have some nuts with our drinks. Little did we know that on our bill we would be charged a ridiculous amount for these nuts (£6-7 GBP). Most bars give this complimentry yet they charged so much for so little. Really disappointed. On NYE after we had returned from the countdown at the Shibuya Crossing, we asked if we could have one drink at the bar but were told no- perhaps they were at capacity but they didn't seem to care much when turning us away. My husband woke up extra early on New Year's day to go upstairs to view the first sunset (it was promoted by the hotel as a guest only event) but he was initially told he couldn't enter even though he was the first person to arrive- it was all a bit odd and the man was not helpful to him.For the fact that we had spent five nights and quite a bit of money staying here, I just didn't feel that Japanese hospitality that I'd become used to elsewhere. The bathroom was ok but the toiletteries were not very good and I'm glad I'd still kept mine from previous hotels which I ended up using.The most helpful person was the sweet girl at the porter desk who helped me find out where they sell the amazing Panasonic hair dryers that are in the rooms. We stayed in the Capitol Tokyu Hotel in the first leg of our trip which is in the same group as the Cerulean Tower Tokyu and the service, rooms, toiletteries etc were far better at the former. Seems that the most positive reviews are from those who stayed in the executive suites/floors and received other great benefits from doing so.The hotel location itself is great as it's a 3 min walk to Shibuya Crossing and there's so much to see and do around there. Shibuya station is also a hop away. I don't think we would stay here again if I'm being frank.

We arrived at Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel early evening 28th of December. We took the metro which is relatively easy to get around once you know where you need to make a change to get from point A to point B.Our hotel was located a few minutes from Shibuya station and we took the subway to get to the hotel. You are able to see the hotel from the station providing you use the correct exit.We followed the West exit sign to get to our hotel. The check in was relatively quick and first impressions the hotel was easy to get to and also very clean airy inside. We were taken to our room located on the 26th floor which had good views.Unfortunately, we were facing the road side rather than over the city. Although we had requested city view it but we let it slide as jet lagged kicked in and we decided to venture out for dinner quickly.There are so many restaurants located near the hotel and you are not short for choice. After dinner we decided to head back to the hotel and ask the hotel concierge to request a seat for the bar for New Year's Eve. We were informed by the staff that a reservation was not necessary and we could go up there on the day. With that information we went of on our way back to our room to rest. As we woke up around 2am due to jet lagged we had spotted a 7 Eleven attached to the hotel outside. We ventured there to grab some snacks. As we had metro cards(our version of the oyster) we could use this to purchase our goods. This can also be used in other shops too. Around 3am we went to the concierge to try and get a taxi to the fish market which has now relocated. Unfortunately, no taxi was waiting outside. The hotel informed us that they could call a taxi in but there would be a charge for them to call. I found this quite surprising as the lady we had helping us barely looked for a taxi and to then try charge us was a bit of a shock to say. We declined this as the call would have set us back £30. We walked to the main road and were easily able to find a cab. By the time it got to New Year's Eve we saw the sign on the hotel board that advised a reservation was required to go to the hotel bar. We went to the concierge to enquire as this is not what we were advised. Unfortunately, all of the seats had been reserved by this point and we could not get a reservation. I went back to the room while my partner decided to go to the hotel bar to explain the situation and see if they could do anything. Luckily for us a few cancellations happened and we were able to get seats by the bar with a good view (see picture 3).From this experience of the hotel unfortunately, we will not be going back or recommending it as the staff provided mixed information and also a lot of them were not able to communicate in English which made understanding difficult as they were unable to answer our queries.However it has not hindered our experience of Japan and I hope to go back to visit other places as the time there passed by really quickly.

We stayed at the executive suits and they were newly done and had great views. Also the executive lounge is fantastic for drinks and breakfast. It works very well. The location is very good as near shibuia station. Lots of places around. The only comment I’d have is that they should have concierge services for longer hours and probably the service although very friendly and nice is not at the level of top Tokyo hotels in terms of knowledge, personalised assistance, and overall helpfulness. But again this isn’t a major thing. I’d stay here again if I satisfy in the area.

Great bathroom ! Best bed ever ! Best pillow ever !The only thing was that kids under 12 are not allowed in the executive lounge,not even for breakfast so we had to take a tray back to the room for them every time.

Our family spent five nights total at the Cerulean over the holidays. The location is fantastic - very close to Shibuya station, which has easy access to trains to almost any neighborhood in Tokyo, but on the other side of the motorway so it has an enjoyably calm environment (and also within walking distance to lovely Daikanyama). We spent four nights in rooms on regular floors and, after a visit to Kyoto, one night on an executive floor. The rooms are spacious and well appointed - comfortable beds, good lighting, excellent bathrooms - and had wonderful views of Mt. Fuji. Executive rooms are on higher floors and have nicer amenities and furnishings. None of the rooms were cheap, but relative to other luxury properties in Tokyo, the Cerulean is a great value.This is a fairly large hotel, so you won't get highly personalized service, but the staff were very friendly and accommodating, and well organized. And before our arrival the concierge was helpful in booking a reservation at a Michelin-starred sushi ya in Ginza.The executive lounge is much quieter for breakfast than the bustling lobby restaurant, though both offered a nice selection of Japanese and western foods. Great way to start a jet-lagged day. The bar on 40 has spectacular views over the city and is not to be missed. We also really loved the convenience of a 7-Eleven in the hotel and a stop on the Limo Bus from Haneda.

The location of this hotel is very strategic, the room was decent for Japan hotel, the hospitality of the staff was amazing, and it has beautiful view over Tokyo Tower. It has been pleasant stay at Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel.

Impressed before arriving to this hotel as their Conceige, Ms Naoko, assisted in booking restaurants, bags transfer etc whilst we were still in Australia most efficiently. The checkin process was handled most efficiently and every member of staff spoke fluent English. They even met our online request to have connecting/adjoining rooms and our bags that were transferred from another hotel were in our rooms waiting on our arrival!Rooms are of very good size with modern and absolutely functional bathroom- definitely 5 star standard! Coupled with spectacular views from our rooms, we were very very pleased! We don’t even need to go to the Tower’s Bar Bellovisto on 40th floor to enjoy the view. Glad we did cos there was life music and stunning views too. 5 mins walk to the train station and lots to do around the hotel area. Would recommend this hotel anytime especially in a nation where anyone hardly ‘spoke English, this is definitely a bonus and the help they offer is second to non! Thank you everyone for making our stay so enjoyable!

We stayed in two room on the executive floor with full access to the lounge and this formed the third stay in our three place stay of Tokyo. We arrived from Nagano so welcomed the comfy beds, biggish rooms and lovely service.However, at breakfast when we asked for fired eggs, the check refused and advised could only do omlette (bizarre seeing as he is a chef), so we eventually spoke to someone with a 'can-do' attitude yet had to wait 10 minutes every morning as they were cooked on the 2F resturant and sent up.Great location for walking around Shibuya, Harajuka and just exploring in general. Concierage very helpful in giving directions and recommendations.We stayed in rooms 3422 and 3423 and whilst lovely rooms with great views to Mt Fuji, be aware that you are under the executive lounge and at night, after 10pm it can be a little noisy in the room as the exec lounge is cleaned up and gotten ready for the next day.

I’ve just arrived and currently staying for NY in an executive king room x 2 with a 15yr old and 8 yr old. After having booked and fully paid for rooms we find out that the executive lounge is not available for our youngest daughter...not made clear at booking and worse still she can’t even attend breakfast..clearly not a family hotel, neither kid can even use the pool..Adults only here, beware..makes a 5* experience 3* if you have kids..big let down and it’s not even busy

Modern and well appointed business hotel, which is also suitable for families. The rooms are of a decent size for Japanese standards. We had a room fitting us and our three kids including one baby. The service is great, the only issue is one typical for Japan: not enough kid-friendly restaurants. Staff is efficient, friendly and speak good English. I would recommend the Cerulean to anyone who wants a quality stay in Tokyo.

Great hotel for the start of our trip. Easy to get to from the airport, close to JR Office - Train Station and perfect location to walk around Shibuya. Also, very friendly and helpful staff - helped us to organise our snowboards to be transferred to our next accomodation while we visited Kyoto for a few days.

We stayed in the suite and it was pretty amazing. There were extra mats in the closet and lots of extra bedding, which made for some fun sleeping on the floor. We also loved the traditional Japanese shower and wooden bathtub. There were also lots and lots of L'Occitane toiletries.

The size of the room is just right . The bathroom is also quite big and generous with the amenities. Very clean rooms with comfortable bed. Perfect location. Walking distance from the tran and shopping.

hotel is spacious for a family of 4 (10 & 14) and comfortable. walking distance to shibuya JR and metro station & shopping. food is also easily accessible. hotel staff are friendly and we checked in earlier and left baggage at the conceige. When we get back our luggage has been sent to our rooms. also the airport limo bus goes directly from narita and it's so convenient especially when we are going to Narita after all the shopping and luggages! love it!

Service in this hotel is top notch. The staff is attentive and very helpful.The rooms were unusually large for Tokyo.The bathroom was a dream.The views were great.The only drawback was the Wifi was unbearably slow.

First time staying in this hotel. I would definitely come back again. Room was spacious & clean. Very conveniently located. Staff were also very friendly & speaks good command of English. Breakfast was sumptuous and their bread was excellent. Looking forward to come back to stay in this hotel again. All the time, we stay in Shinjuku Hyatt or Hilton. But I like this hotel better. Thank you.

Verry good hotel next to shibuya station. Clean, large rooms. The only thing is you have to pay for using the swimming pool. We stayed on high floor and the view was stunning. Breakfast was good. The service and hospitality was amazing

Stayed 3 nights on 1st week of Dec 2018. Booked 2 rooms. Room views are magnificent. Love the comfy bed, bathroom are spacious. Location is a 5min walk from Shibuya Station (we took the Hachiko exit, turn left and just walk straight, then use the elevator up to the pedestrian bridge, use the elevator down (opposite of the busy highway) and walk straight towards the hotel. This area is quieter as compared to the Shibuya 109 area, which we love as it is not so human packed and easier to walk. Best part of staying here was the airport limousine which is just located at the basement of the hotel. :)

I found this hotel when I was planning our trip to Tokyo. Its located just 2 minutes walk to Shibuya station. We book King room for 2 adults and 1 kid. Its a perfect size. They have quite spacious bedroom and bathroom. There is 7 11 located on the second floor of the hotel. Super convenient. Wifi was good. Limousine bus to and from the airport will stop here also. We will definitely come back to this hotel whenever we come to Tokyo. Of course, if they can offer the best rate :)

We stayed at this wonderful hotel for a week. This hotel is just a 3 minute walk to the Shibuya Station which was very convenient. There were lots of eateries around the hotel and many family convenient stalls. We took a Limousine bus direct from Haneda and it was the first stop. No hassle.The hotel staff were polite helpful and warm. We were always greeted with a smile.The rooms were very clean and furniture new.The showers were very clean and upmarket. The water pressure was also very good which was a plus to me.The concierge even helped us book a day tour to Mount Fuji and we enjoyed the excursion.Overall, an excellent experience and we will surely stay at this hotel the next time we visit Shibuya.

I love the Shibuya area with trendy shops and full of youth culture. The area has many shops and the hotel is beautiful and classy.5 min walk form shibuya station est exit, cross over the overhaead bridge and walk along route 246. 5 minutes walk from Shibuya mark city. 85 min from narita international, 60 minutes from Haneda,25 min from Tokyo Station and 15 minute from JR Yamanote Line

We stayed here for 5 nights mid November 2018 and really loved it. As others have stated the location is great. We used the gym only once as we were so busy sightseeing and although it wasn't large it had enough equipment and weights with a stretching area that was more of a corridor. The pool was lovely. The Cerulean Tower Tokyu has wonderfully professional staff and the rooms are very roomy with a couch and small table. We had a lovely view of the city. The bathroom is roomy with a large shower/bath cubicle and good amenities. The bed was very comfortable and welcome after all the walking we did everyday. We will stay here again.

This hotel proved to be an excellent choice for us. We used the airport limousine bus to get down right in front of the hotel which was very convenient. There are plethora of food options nearby. The shibuya crosswalk was a 5 minute walk. The superior king room we stayed in had an exceptional view of Mt.Fuji And sweeping views of Tokyo city. The room has all the amenities one needs and more. The staff are helpful and go out of their way to help resolve any concerns. The shibuya station is a 5 min walk and the hachi memorial is right near by. There is also a 7/11 on the second floor of the hotel. The staff, the room, amenities and location are all excellent. On my next trip this will be my choice again.

My wife & I stayed here for 2 nights. Hotel was a 5 min walk from the Shibuya station. I booked a corner king room. Upon checking in, we were upgraded to an executive corner king on the 34th floor without the use of the executive amenities. No big deal. Wasn't going to use the swimming pool or gym anyways. Room was big & clean. We had a view of Mount Fuji & a little of the Shibuya crossing from our windows. We could see the entire city from our room. It was beautiful. Bed was nice & comfortable with fluffy pillows. Would definitely stay here again.

I would come here again. Loved the hotel. It's quality. Service is excellent. Willing to help and go the extra mile. Near to the heart of Shibuya. Good for kids. Excellent range of restaurants in the hotel.

The Cerulean hotel is very comfortable. Rooms are well-appointed and very clean, with amazing views (we had a view of Mt Fuji). We were there for a wedding, and wanted to be close to Yoyogi Park, so this was a very convenient address. However, Shibuya is not the nicest area of Tokyo (it's kind of like a cross between Times Square and Fulton Station in NYC). It feels a bit corporate, but staff are friendly and helpful, and the lobby is beautiful. Overall, a good value for the price.
user_name:
r7k
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is situated in the center of Shibuya just a 10 minute walk to the famous Hachico Exit of the Shibuya crossing. There are so many shops and restaurant near the area. The hotel is very grand especially the lobby. We booked a room for 3 persons and we were a bit disappointed because the room was quite tight for the price of a 3 bedroom that they charged us for. But then again most rooms in Tokyo are quite small. The room was modern, clean, and well appointed. The bathroom was very nice and had a tub and a shower. It was also very clean and complete with amenities. View was spectacular! The hotel privided a handy phone with wifi which you could use while you are in Tokyo. This was very helpful. They also provided complimentary water . My only observatiin was that for the price we paid, they did not serve complimentary coffee sachets in the room unlike other hotels we stayed in. The bed was firm and sheets were very clean. Over all experience is good but we booked 2 rooms because we are 6 and we dont think the room is worth the price we are paying for a triple.

On arrival at the hotel we were well impressed. We were received with courtesy and such respect. The hotel is modern and very well appointed with spacious reception and lounge areas, both clean and highly polished as was the efficiency and helpfulness of the staff. Our room was modern and had all the facilities one would expect of such a high class hotel. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable, the bathroom met the same high standard. There was a free smartphone for use around the city, a very useful asset. The location of the hotel was just a short walk to the lights, shops, railway station which is a well appointed Mall, an excellent and comfortable stay, certainly a place to stay again. Highly recommended.

Staying in Cerulean tower right now. It is our third hotel this trip to Japan. Unfortunately it is slso the leadt favorite. It does have lively bathrooms and comfortable beds. However the rooms have no space to store luggage or clothes. So even the too. Is ok size ( corner room) it feels very cramped. Moreover this hotel not only lacks japanese hospitality it lacks basic welcome feeling. Being in Japan for 10 days we got used to friendly smiles and amazing service, alas Cerulean tower has none. We are not picky people. Therefore this hotel is not for picky travelers. Its just a place to crush. Nothing more.

Shibuya is the perfect location , central , close to a main Underground .You will appreciate the calm and the comfort of this well designed room .Its pretty high and the view is spectacular .few restaurants , nice place for breakfast , good coffee and pastry .Its a big hotel ... lobby is weird ... but impressive .Service is , like everywhere in Japan : Excellent .*** a special thought to the Concierge who knows everything and beyond ...Thank you !

First time stay at this hotel. A beautiful hotel in central Tokyo. Got an amazing room on the 29th floor with sweeping view, including that of Mount Fuji! Bathroom, all amenities excellent. Great breakfast/lunch buffet (at extra cost). Competitive prices with other 5-star hotels in Tokyo.
user_location: Nassau County, New York, United States
user_name:
Eric M
Nassau County, New York, United States

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and enjoyed every minute of it. It's right in the middle of the action packed Shibuya neighborhood which we loved. The hotel is huge so has dining and cocktail options within the hotel if needed, although there are dozens of amazing dining options within walking distance. There is a 7/11 convenience store on site which surprisingly has the best breakfast foods (ie steamed pork buns, chicken katsu). Added bonus: this hotel is included in the Airport Limousine Bus route from the airport.

Stayed here in a room on the business floor that gave access to the lounge. The lounge is great for a relaxing breakfast with views over the city. We even managed a great view of mount Fuji on our first morning. The lounge also offers afternoon tea and evening drinks. Staff throughout the hotel were great. The location of the hotel makes it a great base for exploring Tokyo. The hotel also supplies a 'Handy' phone to take about with you.

.Firstly, there are better hotels with serious WOW-factor in Tokyo with better rooms, better service and which are beautifully designed with great amenities. But I can definitely say that I will be staying at the Cerulean Tower again, and that's 100% down to location. For me it was perfect, and beat the better hotels I have stayed at in Tokyo. I was out and about 90% of the time, and being in the heart of Shibuya, a walk from Harajuku and Omotesando, made this hotel unbeatable for me. Also, a 3 or 4 minute walk to the easy-to-navigate JR Line which gets you everywhere is perfect. Plus, a 10 to 15 minute journey to Shinagawa for the Shinkasen is a further bonus for getting around Japan.Now, for my three gripes. You've paid extra for an Executive Level room. I think a 10.00am clearing away of breakfast is unacceptable. Why the rush ? There are people on vacation who want to relax, plus they are adjusting to a different time-zone and jetlag. Also, the food offerings at the Executive Level were so Westernised. I don't want Western food in Japan. Surely there could be a mix of Japanese and Western ? Lastly, I'd like to watch a bit of TV in bed before going to sleep. A huge percentage of the World speaks English. Why only CNN and BBC World News to watch ?Regardless of my gripes, I will definitely stay again..

I’ve stayed at this hotel before. It’s a quintessential Tokyo hotel with great views from the rooms and a central location, however the hotel is a little dated and the food is poor.Here’s what’s great...Location - this is a great asset of the hotel. You can walk to Shibuya and Harajuku so you’re never short of great restaurants, bars and shops.Design - although the hotel is quite old, there is something classically Japanese about it which is quite appealing. I ended up in an executive room which was far better than the standard rooms which are starting to look tired. Views from most rooms are spectacular. Service - service is overall good (with the exception of my check-in experience) and there are plenty of staff around to help out. Here’s what I didn’t like:Food - the food is consistently bad. Just some examples....1. ordered room service. 41$ for a burger, 11 fries (I counted) and soft drink. The burger was so undercooked I couldn’t eat it.2. I ate at the lobby restaurant and ordered pasta. The tomato sauce was almost pink and the bacon again totally undercooked.Reservation Mix-Up - when I arrived to my room they had given me a twin room although I was alone. The front desk told me they didn’t have any king rooms available and that I had booked a twin. I’ve never booked a twin before and my confirmation did not state bed type. The front desk did not manage the situation well as I was not willing to stay in a small single bed for my stay. The only offer was a paid upgrade which would cost me an additional 200$. Good customer service would have moved me free of charge - it’s not my fault the standard king rooms were sold out. This put a dark shadow on the rest of the stay.

We stayed here for three nights B&B while on a tour of Japan with Travelsphere from the UK. Perfect hotel - great location, charming staff, great views from the room and immaculate. We did not want to leave as it ticked all the boxes for us.Plenty of restaurants on your door step and within the hotel complex. Able totake a short walk to gain access to shops and activities. Breakfast is fabulous, great choice, well presented and nicely cooked. Perfect stay.

Very nice hotel in the middle of everything in Shibuya! Minutes away from walk to the train station and shopping district. The accommodation are very clean with nice amenities. The breakfast buffet was as close as an American breakfast as you can get. Bed and pillows were comfortable and the bathroom was very nice. We were in a king deluxe.

To tell you the truth, we were not exactly the type of guest Cerulean Tower cater to. I'm a single income dad with a teenager and we certainly travel on a budget. So we barely scratched the surface of all the services and high-end restaurants, this hotel has to offer. But the room we stayed in was great, clean and with a spectacular view of Tokyo. Very central close to Shibuya station and the Shibuya area. I did however sit for a drink ans a snack in the hotel bar on 40th floor. Nice and good service. Also I tried the spa-area. Not the most spectacular hotel spa, but clean and since I was the only person there, it was a meditative break from buzzing Tokyo. Also there is a 7eleven on the 2. floor. The morning buffet is a bit pricey but great!

Really like this place. Very comfortable and convenient by bus or taxi for short distances. Tokyu department store really is a find nearby. Close enough to the Shibuya train station. Really feel at home. No available dates so staying in ikebukuro next time.

The hotel is located within 5 minutes of walking distance to the Shibuya JR station. Our room has a great city view overlooking the beautiful Tokyo skyline. Room was pretty spacious in compared to most hotels in Japan. Breakfast was served on the lobby floor with a wide variety of both western/Japanese style dishes.

We spent one night here before our departure from Tokyo and it was the PERFECT place to see Shibuya and the surrounding area. We arrived on the train to Shibuya Station and the tower is so large it is easy to spot from the South Exit. Just getting across the street and into the hotel takes only a few minutes. The hotel is very large, they seem to cater to more business type clients but we felt welcomed for our short stay. We were on the 28th floor with an amazing view that included Shibuya Station, Tokyo Tower, the Skytree, and so much more. The room is very large for such a location, and even the bathroom was very spacious. There was a closet for us to store our suitcases and hang items. It was perfect, we only wish we could have spent more time here. Being so close to the acton we were worried about noise but didn't notice any at night. It was great. The rooms also contain "handy" cell phones for you to use, which come in very useful when exploring the city.

My 16-year old son and I were scheduled to stay at this wonderful, highly recommended hotel the last week of October 2018. Unfortunately, my son had a medical emergency and our trip was cancelled. We booked four nights at the Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel that were non-refundable. After sending 1 email with the details of my son's condition - the hotel was kind enough to offer us a full refund. Words cannot express how much this act of kindness meant to my family at a time that's both scary and costly - on many levels. THANK YOU to your staff and all who made this exception. You are wonderful!

Cerulean tower is perfectly located near Shibuya station. Access to train and subway lines is 5 minutes away. IF you know where to go, you can walk from the subway with suitcases via an overpass. It is the second time we have stayed there. There is a fabulous Schezuan restaurant on site. The food is delicious and very reasonable. We had a cup of tea in the breakfast restaurant upon arrival. It was very expensive and very ordinary. We didn't try the other hotel restaurants. There are many very good restaurants nearby. There is also a great 7/11 shop near the entrance that goes to the overpass. Shopping, transport and restaurants are all nearby. The rooms are very well appointed and comfortable.

We have just checked out of the cerulean tower Tokyu Hotel. The staff are by far the friendliest and most helpful I have come across during our stay in Japan. We were welcomed with some speciality Meji chocolates.The rooms are spacious, with all the amenities of five star hotel. The view from our interconnecting family rooms was spectacular.

I am so glad I chose this hotel to begin my trip in Japan! The room was very large by Japanese standards! The customer service at the front desk and delivery/concierge areas were fantastic. I had a great view on a high floor. Housekeeping was on point- amenities were replaced every day. Close to JR, shopping, and all kinds of restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
cshower
New York City, New York

review_body: My family and I (2A+2C) stayed at The Cerulean Tower this week on our first visit to Tokyo. All aspects of our stay were convenient and efficient. We caught the Airport Limo bus directly to the hotel, checked in with ease and spent 4 lovely nights here. We booked 2 adjoining rooms, which afforded luxurious space. We were blown away by the Handy phone in each room, which allows guests to access the internet and make international calls to certain countries for free. The phone allowed us to find our way around the busy Tokyo public transport system because of free internet access. Staff are professional and friendly and went out of their way to help us with any query. The hotel has set a really high standard, which I have no doubt we will find hard to beat. The icing on the cake is that it was affordable for the amenities and service provided. Location was so close to Shibuya Station for convenient access to the rest of Tokyo and beyond. We were not short of food choices with the many restaurants nearby. Shibuya Crossing is an experience on its own! Shopping in Shibuya caters more to teenagers/young adults.

We stayed here for 5 nights, and I cannot fault it. Great view of Shibuya, 300 metres from the station, and close to hundreds of great restaurants. We were on the 28th floor, room was large by Tokyo standards and comparatively priced to other similar places I researched. We had lovely (but pricy) drinks in the 40th floor bar, with impeccable service and a breathtaking view. The room was spacious, clean, with a great bed, lounge, free bottled water every day and an internet accessible phone for daily use which was so handy for our exploration of the city. Staff were courteous and helpful. There are several in house restaurants but we didn’t visit any of these. Highly recommend this place to anyone.

We booked Cerulean Tower based on its location and pool. As other reviewers state, its a short walk to Shibuya station and local shopping. The area is vibrant particularly in the afternoon and evening. The hotel staff were extremely polite and friendly. Always eager to help if they could. I could not fault them at any point and the entire staff team should be commended for their exceptional service. We were very grateful.My only real disappointment here was when checking in, we were told that use of the pool was not included in the hotel rate. It was approx $25 AUD PER DAY more to use the pool. Given the high price we paid for the room only, this was a bit of an insult. As it turned out the pool would have been enjoyable at the end of each stinking hot and humid day exploring. What a disappointment. The top floor bar was under renovation when we stayed so we didn't get to try it. We did have a drink in the lobby bar one night. They had a violin/piano duo playing which was nice.We tried the hotel breakfast one day but it was very expensive (~AUD$40 p/p) and not worth it in comparison to other nearby options.The room was large with a big marble bathroom, and the bed was very comfortable. We couldn't see mount Fuji because it was so hazy but the view was nice. The tower is significantly larger than any nearby buildings. All hotel rooms start on the 19th floor (there are offices below that level).

ベロビスト・リニューアルオープンおめでとうございます。㊗️。早速、ベロビストへ行ってきました。✨グラマラスなソファーに、眼で楽しめる空間を演出。今回は余り時間が取れなかったのですが、是非ゆっくりまた伺います。紙ストロー使用でエコへの気遣い、お食事の演出とトロけるお味、勿論美味しいお飲み物に、乾杯です。Congratulation for renewal opening, Bello Visto!Atmosphere is fantastically glamorous ✨ and uplifted so well. Touched of ecology, tongue melted tasty food, and glittering sparkle Impressed me Fantastically!Good job and we will be back

Reaching the hotel from Haneda airport was very convenient with the airport limousine bus – took about 45 min which drops right in front of the hotel.We had booked an Executive Room so check in was done on the Executive Floor. Check-in setup is a bit odd -they lead you to a table against a window (with a nice view of the city), but you need to turn around everytime to give them the documents they request, or answer questions, and get the hotel instructions from them. A straightforward check in with the person in front sitting on a desk would be simpler and more efficient, and then they can lead you to the other table for a welcoming drink. Our room was recently renovated, and it was very nice, clean, with comfy bed. The view of the city was magnificent. We had access to the executive lounge so we had breakfast there daily, which was very good. The executive lounge also offered complimentary evening light meal and drinks between 5-7:30pm, which was extremely nice – excellent quality and great selection. Hotel lobby had live violin & keyboard music which was very pleasant.Hotel was conveniently located within 5 minutes walk from Shibuya subway station, famous shibuya crossing and a mall with many coffee shops and restaurant options. We recommend this hotel.

For me the hotel staff service was incredible, always there to help and great facilities on hand within the building. Including the airport limousine bus service, which drops you off right outside the hotel.Location was great, a short walk from the famous Shibuya crossing and surrounding stores.The room was nice enough, but honestly I’ve been to better five star hotels.

This hotel includes a number of restaurants and shops.Our room in the executive section was fairly cramped and rather small.Check in could have been better but some of the issues we had were resolved in time.Average buffet breakfast.
user_name:
MILOUW
New York City, New York

review_body: I have stayed at the Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel many times but have never written a review. Away from the hustle and bustle of the center of Shibuya. This hotel is conveniently located near the Shibuya JR Station, many other metro lines and shops. All rooms have great views as they are all above the 19th floor. Rooms are much bigger than the other Japanese hotels. Friendly and efficient receptionists and bell desk. Btw, there is a 7/11 too on the 2nd floor. On this occasion, I was on the executive floor (32nd to 37th floor) where check in was done on the 35th Floor instead of in the lobby. The newly renovated Executive Lounge where you can get some peace and quiet. Breakfast was simple but sufficient. Free afternoon tea, pre-dinner drinks and finger foods are served for the guests staying on the executive floors. Staff was great.There is also an indoor pool and a gym. I love the lobby lounge where they make good coffee! It is a popular place for the locals to meet and it is always full. On the top floor, there is a nice bar for drinks. Concierge is wonderful, Ms Naoko (Chef Concierge) has an extensive knowledge of many great recommendations, an extremely professional lady with excellent customer service. Ms Yoko is also part of the Concierge team. I particularly thank them for their help when I stay at this hotel. I would not stay anywhere else in Tokyo.

Good things:1- great location near shibuya station and shibuya crossing 2- free wifi3- complimentary water4- big bathroom and bedroom 5- airport shuttle stop infront of hotel6- nice breakfast (no brown breed)7- best concierge Need to improve:1- reception need to know english 2- if u want late check out even half hour more u need to pay (we stay more than 8 days) 3- table in middle of room hope we can take it off (no need)

Started our first visit to Japan in Tokyo. As an iPrefer member and after comparing hotel prices and accommodations, my husband and I chose our first 5 night stay at the Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel. What a fantastic hotel! Located in Shibuya it is a 3-4 minute walk to the Shibuya Train Station and the Shibuya Hachiko Crossing (the busiest crossing in the world). The area around the hotel is like New York’s Time Square and very alive and filled with great restaurants, bars, shopping and people watching. Our room was on the 27th Floor with a spectacular city view. Our room had excellent appointments and was very clean with large bedroom and bathroom. Also the bathroom had a full wall window with the same outrageous view as the bedroom. Shout out to the hotel staff who made sure that are large pieces of luggage were transferred to our next Tokyo hotel while we were in Kyoto. When we arrived back in Tokyo after 5 days, our large luggage was waiting in the room of our next Tokyo hotel. Overall staff and service was incomparable. Can’t wait to go back!

Wonderful hotel right in the center of Tokyo in shibuya district , close to lots of shops and restaurants. Amazing room with lovely view to Mount Fuji. Warm hospitality, booked us a return bus to the airport very convenient. Thank you for an amazing stay. Looking forward to come back in the future!

Stay in executive floors if possible. Breakfast included and cocktails in the afternoon. Excellent views and great position few minutes walk to Shibuya crossing, the hotel is easy to spot as it dominates the skyline. Friendly staff who are very helpful.

I used to live in Tokyo and when friends visited, they always stayed here. It's in the heart of Shibuya with easy access to the trains and it was walking distance to where I used to live. Its also great because when taking the bus from either Haneda or Narita, this hotel is the first stop. Also, when leaving the Hotel, you head directly to the airport without additional stops.That being said, this hotel is a premium brand and can be quite expensive. The hotel is clean and staff is good but I don't feel like the experience was over the top and wow'd me. The hotel is the tallest building around so if you book on the upper floors, You'll get expansive views of Tokyo. When checking in, ask for the Mt. Fuji view (seen on a clear day) or the Shibuya Crossing view (great view day or night of the Shibuya scramble)I would stay here again but if you are a budget conscious traveller, you may want to seek other alternatives. Some friends that traveled with me on this last trip stayed at an Air BnB right behind the hotel.

I will refer you to the 30 August review titled Hit or Miss. . . our experience was similar to that. We checked in to the Cerulean Tokyu last week for two nights. We were first taken to a room that was absolutely filthy. Disgustingly so. It smelled bad (though a nonsmoking room) and the carpet was covered in stains (as were the hall carpets) and no amenities. Old TV, worn furniture, beat up ancient coffee maker. Bed and bathroom fine but I could not stay in the room. 30th floor. I was ready to find another hotel and it was almost midnight! We complained and asked for a different room. They were apologetic and immediately accommodated our request. We were moved to the 33rd floor - an executive floor. It was like we were in a different hotel. The hall was lovely. The room was fresh - everything was beautiful. Top notch. So - if you are going to stay there, ask in advance for a non-smoking room on a RENOVATED floor.Breakfast was OK - not spectacular but OK. The Italian restaurant on the property was quite good. Staff very nice throughout.

There are many good things about the Cerulean. Primarily, it has a great position. It's arguably the best in Shibuya and located very close to Omotesando Avenue and Minamiaoyama. It's therefore very close to a wide array of the coolest shopping and eating areas in Tokyo (which is definitely a big plus).Secondly, the service is good. You feel like you're well looked after. Thirdly, it's uniquely positioned as a relatively affordable 5 star hotel, though it is a far cry from others such as the Peninsula or Mandarin located in Ginza.However, this doesn't mean it's cheap. Unfortunately the state of the rooms let it down here too. They are certainly in need of an update. Food options are equally as ordinary. If it comes down to a question of whether it is good value for money, I would say only just. It really could be a lot better. In saying that, you'd be hard pressed to find a hotel in a better location, with facilities and service as good as the Cerulean's at the same price point. People stay here for safety, convenience and moderate comfort and that's about it.

I stayed at cerulean for five days at the beginning of my trip, and another three days at the end. My two stays couldn’t have been more different. First stay: absolutely incredible room (modern, lots of gadgets including espresso machine, clean!!), great service where everyone went above and beyond. Second stay: AWFUL room (old, dated, no gadgets, kettle from the 1970s, and most importantly DIRTY!! Someone else’s hair in the bathtub, stains on the bedding, stains all over the carpet, and rooms were not cleaned to a good standard throughout the stay. Absolutely disgusting), and disappointing service (we were told twice that we could not sit at a bar with plenty of free seats on the 40th floor before the manager came and said we could). I would hesitate recommending this hotel to a friend because I don’t know which experience they would get....

Surprisingly nice hotel in very convenient Shibuya. The included breakfast is extensive and very good. Rooms are large, good sheets, bathroom and AC. Pool not always included so check what you are buying. If you want to use the pool and didn't get it in your reservation, you just need to join the Tokyu Hotel Loyalty program and get a free pass.
user_name:
ZincFace
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent hotel in central tokyo with 360 degree view of city from higher floors including central park, shibuya crossing , sky tree tower, tokyo tower etc. A quick tour of tokyo was arranged with very courteous staff who managed to show the entire city in just 2 hrs.Though a bit high priced but it is worth that.

Great hotel amazing with helpful staff always very kind. Hotel is situated in the middle of all you need to see in Shibuya and directly opposite the station.Our view was glorious especially at night. Cannot wait to go back.

Luxurious hotel really 'hit the spot' after the long flight from the US. Easily accessible to/from the JR Shibuya station, and a ton of restaurants are in walking distance. We had the breakfast buffet as well, which, while somewhat expensive, was a nice relaxing start to our trip. We stayed on a high floor and had a great view of Tokyo.

Was here on business and am comparing this to the ANA hotel where we used to stay. For a five star hotel it falls short.Hotel in general is dated and the breakfast is no better than a four star. After a day in the office we wanted to have a drink in the bar. The tower bar is closed and so the only option is on the ground floor in the area where they service afternoon tea. On the two occasions we attempted to get a drink we were told they were full and we would have to join the waiting list. This is despite there being at least four tables empty each time. When I said we were guests and even speaking to management it fell on deaf ears. The Japanese restaurant inside the hotel is average at best, there are plenty of other restaurants in the area which serve much better quality, including Nana which is in Mark City.Happy to pay five star prices if service and quality match the rating.

Reasonable hotel but nothing out of the ordinary. Nice views on higher floors. Very expensive, but thats Tokyo. Service terrible. A few restaurants with average and expensive menus - recommend trying surrounding eateries. Top floor bar very pricey and you need to pay for a table unless you sit at bar

Cerulean is my Go-to hotel everytime im in Tokyo...or at least when im paying for it. Its gives a good balance between a spacious american sized room and amenities, and price. Room: i just get the basic room....2 twin beds...i love that the rooms start at a very high floor, so you get great views....ive seen both sides...and they are both great. The window is big unobstructed glass that frames either Mt. Fuji or the shibuya station on the other side. Theres even a space to sit on the ledge if you wanna do the lost in translation by the window shot. I like the fact that the shower is separate from the bathtub...although, there was 1 time i was here, and it was not...but most of them separate. They offer 2 bottles of water every day for free. They also have a loaner cell phone, although i didnt try it. My only negative is the sheets have a hint of cigarette smell. There are smoking rooms in the hotel....and i suspect they wash the sheets in the same batch as the smoking rooms, so you can notice it. Also, the mattress is not as comfortable as i remember it to be....maybe its time to replace with new ones?...or maybe im just getting old and my back is not as forgiving anymore....Hotel- ive been here about 4-5 times already over the years since 2003.....and the decor is still holding up, but it is showing its age. The penthouse bar is being remodeled so, hopefully it will breath new life to the place. I did not try the pool this time, but i remember you had to pay like $50 per day if you wanted to use it. It was a big nice pool...would have been great in the summer months.Service: This is what makes this place shine....everyone is very professional and efficient and very helpful. The concierge team is amazing! Naoko Tsugita and Yoko Sumida were so patient with all my requests and were on the ball when it came to getting me in all the restaurants i wanted to go to. They answered in 24hours and sometimes instantly if you were responding in the window when they worked. After hours, they have a senior manager who took care of us when we had last minute changes in plans. Absolutely worth staying here just for that. bell staff were very helpful as well and polite.Location: Big plus is the Limobus goes directly from narita to the hotel. its so convenient getting in and out of narita into your hotel. Cerulean is adjacent to the shibuya station....you just need go up the overpass to cross the street....if you have bad knees like me or if you have kids in a stroller...its a bit of a pain to go up and down stairs...although you can use the elevator on both ends.... it makes me think if only cerulean was on the same block or side as the shibuya station, it would have been perfect. Shibuya Excel is on the station itself and $40 cheaper but its not as nice as the cerulean. Theres tons of places to eat around the area....even behind the hotel, there are a ton of cool small restaurants you can choose from...or walk across the street to the bigger department store food court or the food show below the Tokyu department store.Overall...this is a great place and ill definitely stay again.

it used to be my favorite place in the past...eventhiugh it was more expensive than the average. Now need to be restyled in rooms and ambience. There are new hotels in shibuya area more appealing, modern at the same price where i would prefer to go.

If you want a comfortable and upscale base to explore Tokyo, this is it. The 3 minute walk to Shibuya station and access to Tokyo sights was amazing. Service and staff were impeccable. Rooms were modern and spacious for Japan, and we had sweeping views of the city. The indoor pool and fitness area was a big plus. You can swim there for free if you join the hotel loyalty program at no charge - just fill out a form. We loved our stay there and would definitely recommend.

So let's be clear, this hotel is beautiful, delightfully staffed, very welcoming, in a superb location just a few hundred paces from Shibuya station and all that Shibuya has to offer. The breakfast buffet is excellent, extensive but expensive at 3326 yen for the "full" proposition. There is easy access to a choice restaurants on separate levels and also a Seven11 type convenience store on site. I am told the top floor bar is marvellous but unfortunately my schedule did not allow a visit. Now for the really strange and also irritating bit. They have a fitness suite with a great range of cardio and strength equipment. But you have to pay for access!????? In a hotel like this!? That is already expensive to say the least!!??? It's unheard of in my experience. In fairness this only matters to the minority of hotel guests that like to work our every day if possible. To everyone else.....who cares about the gym right!? Frankly, at this price, the gym should be free at all times to hotel guests. It must be mentioned that the gym is FREE to access between 06.00 and 07.00hrs, but outside that time, your paying.....and it is more than you might imagine!!! From memory, something like 2000 yen(!). My only other dislike was the furnishing in my non smoking room (2310).....really quite old fashioned and in need of a refurb. Also, the room and indeed the corridor to the room did smell of smoke, on what is stated as a non smoking floor. Yeah right!? This may be the case for the entire floor but I can only objectively comment on my room.So, in summary, a beautiful, but expensive hotel, that from what I could see, needs a decor update in some rooms and a strict smoking policy and needs to get a bit more of a 21st century policy on it's fitness club access. Good but pricey.

Loved the hotel. Great access to Shibuya station and all the energy of Tokyo. However, if you need a peaceful retreat at the end of the day, this hotel is perfect. Also the neighborhood immediately surrounding the hotel south of Shibuya station is really charming as well.

The hotel is beautiful, beds comfortable and clean. Robes, slippers, water were provided. The rooms were spacious for a Tokyo hotel. we had a room on the 30th floor with an amazing view, we just sat on the window ledge and observed the people below. Check in and out was efficient enough, they have a gym and indoor pool but you may not have access to it, depending on your package. Also pool access is for over 18s only! So be warned!

We were glad to pick this hotel from reading other reviews on here. Stayed here for 9 nights and booked 2 rooms. We wanted to book Four Seasons by Tokyo station but got attracted to the Shibuya district. They do have large rooms, American size, but the beds are smaller than Queen. The bathroom was also spacious with large sink counter and shower space. Large windows with great city views. The air conditioner was working great, a huge plus in a hot humid summer. In-room wi-fi has high speed and we had 4 devices running at the same time with no issues (game, movie, surfing).The best was their complementary smart phone (called handy phone) provided in the room (with its own charging station). You can take it out of the hotel for internet/map/calls, saved me over 10000 yen if I were to buy one of those sim cards for my phone at the airport. We walked (with young kids) to the Shibuya station everyday, easy commute to everywhere. Be warned, local Japanese do not know "Cerulean", as we got lost coming back late at night. Breakfast buffet was pricey (3500 yen) but that's average compare to its competitors (from my research), we didn't try it. There's a 7Eleven on the 2nd floor. We asked for COLD (us Americans) complementary bottled water daily after returning from a long day at the Porter desk, they were always happy to give it to us. You will feel like a King/Queen by the excellent service they provide. Despite limited English, each person will try his/her best to help you. We used their hotel limo minivan to move to another hotel by Disneyland, only 9000 yen for 6 people and lots of luggage. I asked the driver to take a side-trip and show us "downtown" Tokyo, no problem and no extra charge. We lost a bag behind, called the hotel and they delivered it to us the next day, only charged me 1000 yen for the gas. Btw, the hotel (Sheraton Grande) we stayed at by Disneyland did not have nice rooms compare to Cerulean.

I’m in two minds about this place. On the one hand, there are some great features. The first is that they provide you with a smart phone to take out and use (yes, it’s a bit of a brick but i found it extremely useful to avoid roaming costs.It’s fine if you just need it for Chrome and Maps). I’ve never heard of a hotel doing this, but wow; what a great touch. A second great point was the room itself - spacious, with good aircon, a big bath and shower, hairdryer, stunning view, comfy pillows, etc. To be fair, for the high cost of the hotel, it was on par with expectations. However the bed was a bit strange - they’d pushed two doubles together to make a bizarre, comically large, Optimus-prime-esque king size. We would have preferred a good old queen, especially if it meant more floor space and avoiding the awkward join seam in the middle.The third good point is the location. Just a short walk to Shibuya station, (and Shibuya itself is arguably the heart of modern Tokyo) but one block removed from the crazy noisy hub of the city, so it’s safe and quiet. Perfect. Now for the bad points. The first is that the gym and pool are not free for hotel guests. Well, the gym is free only if you go between 6 and 7am in the morning... and the pool doesn’t open till 7 so doesn’t even count in this deal. (Logic? Not so much). At all other times, using the hotel gym will cost you ¥2160 (which is almost $30 AUD). Have you ever heard of such a thing, in a 4.5 star hotel?! Charging guests to use the hotel pool and gym! Plus, they conveniently refrained from telling us this when we checked in, despite me asking details about the pool and where it was located (I mean hello - it was the perfect time to drop in a casual tidbit on the random cost right there?). So I turned up to work out at 7:30am and was asked how I’d like to pay, which came as a huge shock. Every other poor point has to do with charges - the buffet breakfast was a whopping ¥3300 (so we didn’t end up doing breakfast there). One night we went to the top floor hotel bar and they said it was a ¥1500 charge per person if we wanted to sit near a window. I mean, come on guys.Ultimately, this place was lovely to stay at, and very well located, (which is reflected in the price), but if you want to use the gym or pool, or eat breakfast there, be aware of the costs.

Japanese hotelrooms are often small. At Cerulean tower you have large rooms, with a great view, for a very reasonable price (for Japanese standards that is). Even in the non-smoking rooms, you can still tell that smoking is not yet banned from Japanese hotels, but it didn't bother me that much. The service is what you'd expect from a Japanese hotel. Excellent. And so is the position of the hotel, right next to Shibuya station. Great choice for business as well as leisure.

Had to stay here for a business conference. It's in the heart of shibuya, so restaurants and sundry shops are nearbyThe room is smallish and old with boring browns. Tv is tiny, old and the booklet instructions to switch channels are wrong. There is no shower stall, only the safety hazard bathtub. There are only 2 shirt hangers in the closet, i suppose it's a hint to leaveGym is small and they have the gall to charge 2200 yen per visitI certainly wouldn't stay here if i was on holiday and paying myself

More convenient to the famous crossing and station than maps might make it appear, this is good location for staying in Shibuya.Rooms and views are good or great depending. Higher floors and more deluxe rooms are best with some having views in all directions including Mount Fuji on clear day. Gym and pool are very good with a lot of equipment and plenty of room in the pool.Food is not as good as I would expect but easy enough to find other options nearby.

Great location close to the heart of the action. Close to Shibuya station (5 min. walk) and then 1 stop to Harajuku. The hotel was nice and has some restaurants attached to it. We never ate at any of them but they seem nice and had varied menus. There's also a 7-11 attached so could easily get snacks and convenience foods/drinks. My kids loved how convenient it was to Shibuya crossing and the Hatchi statue, shopping etc. Rooms were well appointed and good size. Breakfast is not included. They had a small bakery for quick grab items but I would include breakfast with room price if you can as it's $30/person otherwise.We had a room on a higher floor and the views of the city were amazing!

This is a wonderful hotel. It’s within walking distance to the Shibuya station and the Shibuya pedestrian scramble. The hotel is very clean. The rooms are spacious with comfortable beds and pillows. The bathroom is clean with a nice shower or soaking tub. The view from our room was fabulous. So was the staff.

It is within walking distance from Shibuya station. In addition to convenient location for business, we can safely enjoy nightlife in Tokyo only around the hotel. Entering the spacious and gorgeous lobby, when you notice that you entered a sophisticated space, you will be satisfied with choosing this hotel.The employees are kind and admired that they work hard.Even a single room for business is large enough. The bed is queen size and the mattress is standard softness. Bathroom is relatively large.築１７年ではあるが、新築当時のまま、細部に至るまで、良く保守されていた。しいて言えば、高級ホテルにしては、もっと排水音対策に気を使うべきだろう。

I booked this hotel thanks both to the location (a short walk not only from the heart of Shibuya itself but also its station) as well as the mass of positive reviews and I was not disappointed. Staying in a queen I found myself greeted not only by masses of space (something that can be a luxury this close to the more 'touristy' areas of Tokyo) but also an air of sophistication that was only increased by an amazing view out across the Tokyo skyline. The room held not only the expected amenities (the nespresso machine adding a welcomed change to the usual sachets of instant coffee) but also the addition of a smart phone that, if I so wished, could be taken out of the hotel and used for the duration of my stay at no extra cost. I had asked to have a ticket forwarded to the hotel and the staff not only took it in before my arrival but then assured that I received upon my first visit to the hotel despite my arriving before check in time (they also, very kindly, took in my bags and then delivered them to my room in duration between this and my actual check in). In this interaction, as well as all others that I had with the staff, I found them not only polite but very willing to help with any issues that arose (not that I, myself, experienced any true issues during my stay) As one note if, like myself, you only have a debit card make sure you bring cash to pay for your room if you have not already done as such and be prepared to pay for any extra costs (mini bar, laundry etc) when they arise as a 'tab' can only be authorised with a credit card. All in all a very pleasant experience and I fully intend to stay here again in the future.
user_name:
Tash B
Ilminster, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Great location! 5min walk to Shibuya train station. Room is very comfortable and quiet, with incredible view of the city. The hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful, baby crib is available on request. Transportation to airport was easy with airport bus shuttle. Overall excellent experience for our family and we will stay here again.

A hotel that's steps away from the rail-subway hub, in the heart of great shopping, quiet and luxurious.... now that's a super smart choice!Spacious rooms and great service make it more worth your while. The hotel is very large, obviously catering to a lot of conferences and banquets, but that doesn't interfere with an independent guest's overall experience. Too often we see properties of this kind become a mass-market mash, but this one maintains a good balance. In particular, the room was well appointed with great amenities and a lovely view. Prompt housekeeping service and overall high standards made it a delight. Access to the JR station and the nearby shopping is easy and quick... so, location couldn't be better.The only sub-par experience were the long waits for staff to attend to you at the all-day dining restaurant. On the other hand, extra quick and helpful service by the Concierge more than made up for this.

My family and I stayed at the Cerulean at the beginning of our two-week trip. Having 2 teenage daughters, we considered the location excellent for a deep tour of Shibuya. On top of that, we got excellent service, delicious breakfasts and the best beds in town. I'm still researching the pillows they use to buy some for home !!

Spent two nights at this hotel. Booked a superior room (one level up from the standard), and got upgraded to a corner room with windows in the bathroom overlooking the city. Location was superb, a short walk to the Shibuya crossing. Did not tried any of the restaurants but they look quite comprehensive and nice. There is a family mart conveniently located on the 2nd floor.Room was slightly dated, but spacious (well above Tokyo standard), and the view was amazing (we were on 40 something floor). Very good value for money.

This hotel is about a 3 minute walk from the Shibuya station, and from there you can get pretty much anywhere by train. I believe all rooms are above about the 20th floor, so almost all of them have great city views.The staff is extremely helpful and friendly, the rooms are spacious and comfortable, the bathrooms are large and wonderful (2 sinks a shower and a large tub), the beds are great. The breakfast buffet is fantastic. There was nothing about this hotel we didn't like. Expensive, but not by US large city standards. I think it was about $400/night for a deluxe twin room including breakfast for two and taxes. And another wonderful thing about Japan: No tipping!

This is a huge hotel whose rooms are quite spacious and comfortable. Our room had a nice view of the Tokyo landscape. The buffet breakfast, especially freshly squeezed orange juice was enjoyable. The spread itself was good. The hotel has a 11-7 shop in its premises which is handy. It is very close to the Shibuya market area

If you’re looking for a great location in the heart of Shibuya and huge rooms, this is the place for you, but you will have to pay for the pleasure. The Cerulean isn’t cheap, but you really can appreciate what you’re paying for as the rooms are the biggest I’ve stayed in in Tokyo. The view is also great and you can see for miles around if you get a high enough room. The best part of the stay was the beds as they basically two large single beds put together so you really spread yourself out. They’re also very comfortable so you’re guaranteed a good nights rest. The bathrooms are just as spacious as the bedroom and are stylishly equipped. Overall a great place to stay if your budget stretches far enough.

First time visiting Japan. Great spot. Walked everywhere. Hotel was great in booking us into local restaurants. Also advised on metro day passes. Excellent staff and service. Had dinner at one of their restaurants one night. Beautiful food.

We (wife and 17 yr old daughter) stayed in this hotel last week and thought it delightful. Modern, beautifully designed and decorated tower. The hotel added a single bed for no additional charge which was a welcome surprise. We had a 27th floor room overlooking Tokyo-the room literature includes a skyline guide to help you orient yourself.The staff were all gracious and helpful, and english is widely spoken.We dined in the 40th floor french restaurant which was superb- either the best or second best meal we’ve ever had. Around $500 for three plus wines.

We enjoyed out stay at the Cerulean. Amazing views. Great location and very close to train station. Friendly helpful staff. Rooms were clean and well appointed. We had the family adjoining rooms which were perfect. Only complaint is the lobby area is closed off until 10am so early risers have very little options.

Excellent staff and service make you feel like royalty everytime you walk in the lobby. Used Agoda.com (specializes in Asia) to book at Competitive rate for Tokyo. 3 minute walk to Yamanote and other JR lines.

We were on our honeymoon and wanted a little bit of luxury while staying in Tokyo and found the Cerulean Tower an absolutely perfect choice. Of course you can find cheaper accommodation in the city, but having checked out many potential places and stayed at other hotels in Japan, I feel that this is really good value for money given the quality. The rooms are great - spacious (and that's a real bonus in Japan), high spec and the staff are amazing. You expect that in Japan, but it really is a cut above - incredibly helpful and friendly. The location is spot on - Shibuya is a great place to stay as a location in itself, but handy for other key sights. The views are incredible of Shibuya itself and across the city, towards the nearby high-rises of Shinjuku. All in all, very happy. I would definitely stay here again.

This hotel was chosen for us by the travel agent. We were pleased with it. Good location, ease of access to use of subway system, rooms a good size, air con could have been more efficient, but as we were trying to get over jet lag, we were up & down a lot of the time. Breakfast was good with a great selection. Good choice.

Excellent position a short walk from Shibuya Station. Very comfortable and spacious club room, and we enjoyed using the club lounge which had a great view of Mt Fuji on a clear day. The breakfast in the lounge was adequate for our needs, although it isn’t very extensive. One drawback of the lounge is that there are no snacks available after 7:30 or 8pm, only some lollies. The service generally was excellent from all staff, and we would highly recommend the Cerulean as a great hotel in an even better location.

What I really don't understand is why a hotel of this class suppresses Whatsapp. An absolute no go. Rooms are nice, not modern anymore but impeccable. View from upper floors amazing. Restaurants an breakfast dramatically overpriced. No complimentary coffee in the room. Nice staff and good services. So all in all surely the best stay in Shubuya. If you are young and dynamic, I recommended Shinjuku

The Cerulean Tower is perfectly located very close to the Shibuya station (and the famous Shibuya Crossing). The rooms are spacious by Tokyo standards and, as can be expected, perfectly organised, maximising every inch. We had a great view of the city below. The rooftop bar is worthwhile for the ambiance and view as well. All in all, an excellent base from which to explore Tokyo.

Location was really convenient for limousine bus to/from airport, Fuji Mountain tour and Shibuya. We can see the Shibuya crossing from the room.The corner room was spacious and comfortable for our 7 nights in Tokyo.Pastry from the lobby was just too yummy , not to miss.The concierge Ms.Tsugita was outstanding in assisting us to book dinner at Shin Hinomoto, Jyomon Roppongi, and Hakushu . She was prompt to reply to email and absolute pro!Highly recommended

I was so lucky booked this hotel during high season of cherry blossom at Japan. Located at the heart of Shibuya Junction and near Shibuya station make this hotel has the best access to go anywhere arou d shibuya, ginza and harajuku. And also you can take pictures of hachicko statue abd shibuya crossroad during peak hours... Awesome.. The hotel itself was awesome. Nice peoples, all english friendly,so I can communicate with them smoothly. This hotel is huge and also very nice. The amenities were amazing, spotless bed and bathroom. The breakfast was amazing, lots of variety of food. Nice service and very quick response from the staff. Highly recommend this hotel for those who has thick budget, this hotel is worth of every penny you've paid for. And also there is a Subway burgers right at the back of this hotel. Sure that can be an oasis when you tired of Japanese cuisine..

If you want to have a great hotel well localised in the amazing shibuya this is the one Big rooms nice breakfast and perfect service The price is correct according to the average price in TokyoNearby the shibuya station easy access to the city !!!

We stayed three nights in a regular room with a king-sized bed. What a nice place! Room is big, the bathroom is awesome, and the bed is super comfy. The location is also great - easy walk to Shibuya Station and all the bars and restaurants in Shibuya.

We were pleasantly surprised by the large room compared to most Japanese hotels. The hotel staff was very friendly and obliging, helping with luggage, directions and information. The in-room Shiatsu massage was the best I ever had anywhere in the world.The airport buses from Haneda and Narita stop in the basement so transportation to and from both airports was very convenient. About 10 min walk to Shibuya station from where you can go anywhere in Tokyo. Many restaurants within 15 min walk from the hotel as well as extensive shopping.

30 minutes from Haneda Airport, 2 minute walk to Shibuya station, 10 minutes to Harajuku, 20 minutes to Ginza. We were in Tokyo for 10 days, and this place made it super easy to get around! Not only were the rooms very quiet (none below the 19th floor) despite being in the center of the city, but the beds were absolute heaven, and all the staff were extremely helpful to us idiot Americans who did not speak Japanese. I won't even bother looking anywhere else if we come back to Tokyo - we will be staying at the Cerulean Tower.

We were located on the 26th floor with wonderful views of Tokyo. The service was wonderful, the concierge even helped us by calling our airline to help attempt to retrieve an item left in flight. The room is large (we were upgraded) modern and clean with comfortable bedding and a small couch, chairs and coffee table, as well as desk. The toiletries in the bathroom also included a kit with 2 types of face wash and a day and night cream for me to use. The location is central and we had a lot of assistance in finding a cab, getting luggage to and fro, and also walking to the nearby Shibuya station.My only small quibble is that I wish that the coffee in the lobby was available earlier in the morning.
user_name:
doctordiana
New York City, New York

review_body: The Cerulean Tower is a beautiful (albeit expensive) hotel in a super convenient location. There is even a currency exchange machine in the lobby. We have stayed there many times. If you want to know everything wonderful about this hotel, there are hundreds of reviews on this site for you to read. So I will focus on the flaws which are not so obvious.1.
