Tokyo is a city to walk around and enjoy the convenience of the subway system and the JR trains. As such, visitors will want to take advantage of the very close Shibuya Station which has convenient connections to anywhere in Tokyo that you would want to go. But you must be very healthy and mobile to enjoy this convenience because to get from the Cerulean to Shibuya Station one must cross over a series of pedestrian bridges. Unless your heart, lungs and legs are in good shape, this could be a daunting task.2. The Cerulean will want to make an imprint of your credit card when you arrive with payment being made on departure. The problem with this scenario is that many brand new chip cards (like mine) are not embossed. As a result, we had to pay for our seven day stay up front. While this in itself may not be a major issue, it meant that I was billed in the current credit card billing cycle and not the next. This is called a cash flow problem. 3. The buffet breakfast should be avoided. It is expensive and, quite frankly, not very good.4. Back to that currency exchange machine. Yes, it is convenient if you want to exchange foreign currency bills to Japanese yen but the exchange rate is not as good as you would find at an ATM.

This is a nice modern hotel ina slightly out of the way location .To get to this hotel by taxi from another part of central Tokyo was 65$.The room was modern and good size .Large king size bed which was extremely comfortable ,good view .Bathroom exceptional by Japanese standards with best Shower of any hotel we stayed in Japan .Breakfast buffet is standards Japanese ,most of the food including eggs/French toast etc is cold /lukewarm,bake goods excellent ,coffee in short supply .omelets undercooked .We had room service one night as we were tired and the food was aweful ,90$ for cold spaghetti and a dreadful chinese noodl/ seafood dish with two shrimp.Best to go round the corner where there is a fabulous cheap Japanese restaurant in the basement at one quarter the cost.

Nothing to fault...everything was perfect. The room size, the executive lounge, the fittings (even the bathroom’s sliding door has a close close so it doesn’t slam!). Well appointed rooms. Room for improvement: the Breakfast spread at the lounge + Japanese Breakfast at L2 can have more variety. Will recommend the hotel.

had to go to tokyo end of march, book flight and 2 nights at this hotel (where i normally stay whenever i go to tokyo - around 20 days a year) the booking was done with expedia, 2 nigths at 804 euro.unfortunately 4 days before departure Airlines cancelled by booking (with due apologies and refund of expenses)but there was no availability on other 10 airlines therefore had to cancel the trip and could not stay at this hotel.informed them of this event and asked them to cancel, if possible the room. they answer that due to the fact that booking was done with expedia they cannot do anything.i have to contact expedia.contact expedia and they inform me that the booking cannot be cancelled, but after informing of the situation expedia understood the problem and was willing to a cancellation or rebooking (which for me was fine) of the room but hotel had to agree. at this point the hotel totally refused to cancel the room, to consider any refund or any other possibility, they just took the money and that's it!warned them in advance, they could have sold the room to somebody else easily, taking some penalty and would have been understandable.instead they completely refused to do anything but get the money and im am also a member of their hotel chain (im sure they also have sold the room to Others gaining double.)at 400 euro per night, no breakfast included, gym not included for a room that is no more than a standard 4 stars (in any other part of the world)too bad....i will spend my future 20/30 nights a year in tokyo in a better hotel.

Spent 6 days in Tokyo - of course room size is very important as rooms in Japan are relatively small. it was a nice hotel, clean, and have modern amenities. The life saver though is free wi-fi this is a life saver as we traverse our way all around the city. The location is not as prime as other hotels closer to the Shibuya crossing, but its a nice respite from the hustle and bustle after walking around for 8 hours. Advantage is its just 8 minute walk to the station, and 5 minute walk from restaurants (lots to choose from)

I've been travelling to Tokyo for business for around 15 years and I've almost always stayed at The Shibuya Excel Hotel! It's still my first choice! The best feature of the hotel is the location. Being situated right next to the famous Shibuya Crossing, it is walking distance to all of the great shopping & eating on offer in Shibuya. As well as being an easy walk to Harajuku & Daikanyama. If you want to travel further afield, the Shibuya Station is just across the road.The rooms are spacious enough and simply decorated. And you can get an amazing view of the Shibuya Crossing from the windowed elevators! Getting to & from either airport is really easy with the Airport Limousine bus which stops at the hotel.

Great location. Stayed here for our last night in Japan. Close to Shibuya station. Stayed in a junior suite with a beautiful view, including a birds eye view of Shibuya crossing. Helpful english speaking staff provided great recommendations for restaurants in the area. Overall, a fantastic choice of hotels in this area of Tokyo.

A very towering height hotel in shibuya which limo bus services tourists right at its doorstep. The room is wide and tge bed can sleep two people with still elbow room. There is a bridge to reach across the block where scenic spots, malls, eateries and train stations are located. The hotel itself also has its own 7/11 tenant and a variety of restaurants here and there. If you plan to focus on tokyo tour, this hotel is indeed the best place to be...

Perfect hotel to start our Japan visit. Can’t beat the location in Shibuya. Direct Bus from Narita airport, 7min walk to Shibuya station and Shibuya crossing. 17 mins train to Meiji shrine, shopping and slightly further train and then a walk to the Samaria museumExcellent, service oriented and friendly staff. Well equipped gym and outstanding breakfast buffetOverall, a great hotel in a fantastic location

Although it takes some time to get to Shibuya from Haneda Airport the airport limousine bus stops right outside this hotel and is an inexpensive means of airport transfer. The hotel has an excellent location very near Shibuya Station and the famous Shibuya crossing. However what took my breath away was the spectacular view from the large window in my room on the 29th floor! I could see Shinjuku city on one side and Tokyo Tower on the other. The room itself had all amenities required (and some more) and was very spacious and spotless. The roomservice was great, the staff in general was great - not many vegetarian hot dishes on the roomservice and restaurants' menus but the staff were open to making changes to suit my needs. The best choice for hotel in Shibuya, although a little more expensive than other options in the area, but for me it was worth every yen!

Great hotel. Across Shibuya station. Surrounded by great restaurants and convenient stores. Room is clean and tidy. Perhaps it is the Japanese culture to keep things tidy and neat and clean. Will return for sure.

We like staying at Cerulean due toits convenience to Shibuya and accessibility via public transportation. We rode the airport bus from Haneda which stopped directly at the Cerulean which was great. The check in was fast. The rooms were spacious & clean. The pillow selection was splendid. It's also 10 minute walk to restaurants and to Shibuya crossing which was a major plus.The only con for us was the aircon which didn't seem to cool enough. Nevertheless, we will definitely stay here again.

We got lumbered with a smoking room when my wife and I are both non-smokers. To me for $850 a night that is a deal breaker. I get it that the hotel was busy but if a non-smoker checks in and books a non-smoking room weeks in advance a true luxury hotel should be able to do something about it. Very unimpressed with the shoulder shrugging front desk staff who blamed our travel agent and offered no solutions. I would not recommend this hotel.

Splendid service. Noticed the birthday of my toddler and gave us a lovely box of sweets. Room was excellent and view was amazing. Small Road further down hotel was filled with Sakura trees! Location not that near but everything else compensate for that

Location - Short walk from the station (note slightly up hill if carrying cases). Personally did not enjoy the location as much as other hotels on our stay due to no fault of the hotel (surrounding areas needs investment e.g. pavements uneven, building work near the station etc). 7- Eleven shop near the hotel and plenty of taxi on the basement floor. Airport buses go directly from the hotel at a variety of times.Check-in / reception - Very professional and quick - we arrived early and were still able to check-in. Room Space - Excellent size room on floor 34. Larger bathroom than the Granvia. Well  stocked mini bar and large TV. Bed / pillows - Exceptionally comfortable (even beating the Granvia) - perfect  nights sleep. Bathroom - Large wet room and bath. The most powerful shower on our holiday  and lots of room. Lighting - Large window and good room lighting. Electronic curtains and blinds.Other The hotel was spotless and the sound proofing in the rooms was good. Large TV, excellent air conditioning and relaxing piano bar. Superior room services for teas, coffee, cakes, cocktail (self service) and breakfast area superb (including friendly concierge).A large amount of handouts / information was given to us which was relevant and helpful for our stay. Cafe and restaurants inside had a good atmosphere.The hotel also provided us with a mobile phone for travelling to avoid roaming costs. Staff - Professional and polite. Less interactive than the Granvia and some struggled with English. Seemed more corporate than the Granvia and as a result less personalised (not a criticism just a perception). Very responsive to emails and requests. Very good first impressionSummaryAn excellent hotel, the only thing I would question is the price vs value given its area / location. Shibuya has a lot to offer, but really I really feel it needs an uplift compared to other regions we stayed in (not as clean / well maintained). Beautiful views across the city and we would recommend this hotel for people staying in the area.

Fully equipped and the view is to die for. wouldn't have it any other way! service is too notch too! A very large and comfy bed. Onsen is amazing. Located 4 minutes from Shibuya station and the shopping district.

A confirmation at this hotel doesn’t count for much. We are a family of 5; my wife, 3 young children and I. Despite having a written confirmation from the Hotel for adjoining rooms, a strong preference for connecting rooms and an email sent a day prior to our arrival to reiterate the above, upon checking in at 12am after a 12hr journey to Tokyo, I was informed that the only two rooms available were on different sides of the floor.Management was unwilling to understand the inconvenience they were putting me through or the logistics of my family having to split our young children on the other side of the floor. We finally got to our rooms at 1am and settled in and slept at 2am. We had to wake up and pack again the next day after I spoke to the General Manager, who offered a feeble apology, and moved us to adjoining rooms. Clearly seemed the management was banking on the fact that I wouldn’t walk out on them at the last minute due to shortage of rooms in Tokyo during peak travel season. GM wasn’t bothered to the least that due to the disruption to our schedule we lost out on part of our planned tour the next day. To further add to our woes, the room they moved us to has loud rattling A/C ducts. We could not even use ear plugs to sleep as we had children in the next room and had to be able to hear the phone in case they called. Had a terrible 2nd nights sleep. Like I said, this hotel is not for families. Management attitude is deplorable.

Our family of four (2 adults, 2 teens) recently stayed here for six nights. Pros of the hotel: easy, fast check-in, very impersonal but efficient. WiFi speed was great -- I was able to stream Netflix with no problems. Water pressure is INCREDIBLE -- hard to leave the shower! Our city-view was also quite nice. The decor was very basic, but clean and comfortable, especially the pillows. The location, close to the Shibuya train station was very convenient. All of the staff we spoke with had almost perfect English and were pleasant and efficient. CONS: This is a very institutional, not overly friendly hotel with no ambiance; which may not matter to you; we would have liked a hotel with a Japanese feel. We rarely saw staff as we were leaving or returning to the hotel because there are so many exits, most of which are not staffed. Added to the impersonal feel. We wanted interconnecting rooms, and so we could not get a room on the executive floor (there are no interconnecting rooms on the executive floors), as a result, we were not able to get the free breakfast in the executive lounge. The buffet on the main floor is roughly $35.00 per person -- not worth it to us to spend $140+ for breakfast. We brought bathing suits only to discover that the pool was for guests over age 18 -- crazy. Also, because we couldn't stay on the executive floor, we had to pay a large fee to use the fitness facilities -- annoying to be constantly asked for extra fees in a 5-star hotel, these amenities should be included. The smell in the hall was very smoky and musty, not pleasant to come home to but the rooms weren't smelly, the air quality isn't terrific though. We also were awoken many mornings by the sound of yapping dogs. I thought I was losing my mind until I discovered what appeared to be dogs being boarded on top of an adjacent low-rise building. They were very loud... I counted 14 or so dogs, all of them little yappy things that constantly barked while they were outside for their "break". Overall, if you are in Tokyo on business, this is probably a great hotel for you. If you are with your family, I would try somewhere else -- probably a different location like Shinjuku.

I’ve stayed at the CT a number of times since around 2012 whilst shooting advertising jobs in Tokyo.The last time I visited (Jan 2018), I took four young children to witness the one-in-50 year snow blizzard that Tokyo experienced on very short notice. I cannot fault the hotel.Initial check-in had us all in one “family room” but after some “clarification”, the hotel Assistant Manager had us all sorted in two very comfortable upper level rooms. The rooms offer gob-smacking views over Tokyo (from 270 degrees). Baths too with windows - Very cool.The staff at this hotel speak English very well, and the Concierge service is nothing short of excellent. They also manage transport and taxis for small and larger groups. Well done people. Apart from the fact that it battles the Grand Hyatt for its excellent breakfast selection as the BEST in Tokyo, the Cerulean Tower is probably one of the tightest-run 5-stars in the city and Shibuya (with its associated crossing) is a stone’s throw from some of the more desired inner-city destinations. We travelled (all of us) for three days on the Tokyo Subway and had the whole city at our fingertips. Again, great hotel. Stirling location.But beware. It’s not “cheap”. You get what you pay for. It comes highly recommended.

A very good hotel because of his localisation ; closed to nices places and a street with good restaurants every thing was ok : the room, the very good brekfast, the persons ........I strongly recommende it

We stayed only 1 night at Cerulean Tower Tokyu hotel. Check in was fast and we really enjoy the view from the room. The hotel bathroom style is also very unique with common shower - bathtub area. There is a 7 Eleven at one of the hotel floor so it is very convenient. Short walking distance to nearby Shinjuku area for shopping, food and Hachiko statue. Will consider returning again.

Was not cheap as ours was triple room. But location was good, a short hike uphill from Shibuya station. If you have luggage walk on the opposite side of the road from the hotel, theres a walkway with lift access. Room was good size, amenities sufficient. Quite some rules and extra costing on the fitness center. Would make more sense if they just allow all guests to use as the facilities are very under-utilised. Went 3x and we were the only guests there. For those going to airport the shuttle bus is very convenient, tickets can be bought at the porter counter.

I stayed at this hotel for business as my employer has an office in Cerulean Tower. The room was very nice, standard "business hotel", with great views across Tokyo. The bathroom had a Japanese toilet, complete with warmed seat and complicated options. The complex has several options for food, including a Japanese restaurant (ok), an Italian restaurant (avoid), and a Chinese restaurant (excellent, worth a definite repeat). Breakfast at the hotel was pretty standard. I would stay here again on business, but would probably look for a place with a bit more charm for tourism.

I love this hotel. This is a beautiful, luxury, very clean, comfortable hotel. Great location close to shopping and restaurant, spacious and clean room. I especially liked the toilet seat, it was heated and had several different water features. The amenities were like no other I have ever had, many different full size products. Free wi-fi. The staff was extremely respectful and helpful. Umbrellas are available.

Happy to write a review about a top notch hotel in Tokyo. What a pleasure it was to stay at this hotel especially after long travel over from the USA. Rooms were really comfortable. TV's offered English speaking channels and toilet had a heated seat. Something I had never encountered before. Overall the Hotel was great! Restaurant on site in Hotel. Located in a cool part of the city. Great views from the room and staff was super friendly. If you are coming over to Tokyo from the USA then you should check out this hotel because its really nice and caters towards the the USA clients.

We stay at Cerulean each time, because of its unbeatable location, great staff, nice rooms, and a really good value.We really love to be in the middle of Shibuya, but at a walking distance from the quiet Daikanyama and Nakameguro areas.The rooms are very nice and offer great city views. And you have a really useful Seven Eleven in the building...We love this hotel, and will keep returning.(PS: Just a little request for the hotel: the bathrooms, at least in the Tower floor rooms, need a shaving/make up light, and hooks for bathrobes!)

Place is very good and center of shibuya . you will find everything near by .service is good and location is very nice but place is expensive as expected as located in shibuya center .Good for expats and business trips

Stayed at this hotel, they have the perfect Location it is just a bit of trek to Shibuya station about 10 minutes, across a pedestrian. The room was good and clean, staffs are great even the food has is quality. The bed was soft and pillows are fluffy. The room is heaven ! will be back again and will recommend this hotel

I will stay at this hotel whenever travel to Tokyo. The location is good which just walking distance to the famous place shibuya. You can get varieties of food and cafe nearby the hotel. The room is clean and the service is good as well.

Stayed at this hotel for one week on way back from Hokkaido. Generally a great location within a few minutes walk of Shibuya attractions and public transport. Very easy to transfer to hotel from Haneda airport. Staff attentive and generally very helpful. Rooms have good views and are compact by Western standards but well designed and useful. Beds very comfortable and rooms generally quiet although we had some transmitted noise from floor above. Despite staying in a 5 star hotel, however, you pretty much have to pay extra for any of the services other than water! Try $30 to access the gym and pool per person per day, for $70 for three drinks in the bar but no nibbles. Breakfast (fairly good Western buffet style) was $50 per head, with very limited other Western options available locally before 10:00. Restaurants within hotel or hotel complex were simply ridiculously overpriced, at well over $200 a head with no wine or beer. If someone else was paying, I would be happy to stay again.

We booked a Superior Non smoking King room; we only got to check in at about 6pm and to our pleasant surprise, they upgraded us to a corner King room - a very beautifully large room (especially for standard Tokyo city standards; 49sqm compared with the avg 22+sqm!!) on the 29th floor with a clear view of Mt Fuji, the famous Shibuya road crossing and all the way to the Yoyogi park, Harajuku, & beyond! Whan an amazing panoramic view! The check-in was smooth & all the staff were very friendly, informative & fluent in English. The room was neat and clean; fantastic choices of pillows (memory foam, feather & feather/buckwheat); great strong yet gentle shower. I had accidentally left my Cartier watch in the bathroom & spent the whole day out without realizing it until the evening, but I had a feeling that it would be safe in this fabulous hotel; and I was right!!! When I returned to the hotel late that night, neatly placed alongside my toiletries on a hand towel- was my watch! Such honesty- Only in Japan!!! Thank you for an excellent stay, Cerulean Tower!!!(Just for extra trivial information: It is a little bit of a trek to Shibuya station (about 10 minutes, across a pedestrian bridge) and then up a slope as you return from the station. But not too bad in cool weather.)

We stayed here from December 28th to January 2nd. From the start, this hotel was great. The hotel is close to shibuya station which makes getting around tokyo very easy. We had a club room booked here, And although the club isn’t massive, we were always able to get a table. I did note that they are expanding the club room soon. The food and drink service here for breakfast and evening drinks is of very high quality. The food is constantly refreshed and monitored by staff, and although the selection won’t be the biggest you’ve seen, it really has everything you could want for a wonderful breakfast. Again, the smallish selection is more than made up for by the great quality of the food on offer. What really makes this hotel great is the service everywhere. I’ve been lucky enough to stay at some top hotels in the world, and I can say without reservation that the service at this hotel is up there with the best I’ve ever experienced. They truly make you feel like a real “guest” at this hotel. Nothing is too much trouble. The room itself was of a good size, the view we had was simply breathtaking. Waking up to panaromic views of Tokyo and Mount Fuji is something that never gets old. The room was whisper quiet, bed very comfortable and the room extremely well thought out. Everything you need and more is there.The gym, pool,spa and sauna were also very good. We don’t normally stay in shibuya when in Tokyo, but i would find it very difficult to not stay here next time we go.

Stayed with college age son and daughter in rooms on one of the Executive floors. Both rooms had great views of Fuji. The extra cost of the Executive floor was more than made up by the excellent breakfast, and the free drink happy hour at the end of the day in the exclusive lounge. The hotel is modern, comfortable, well-designed, luxurious without excess or affectation. Everything just worked, from the walk-in closet, to the pushbutton shades and curtains, to the Nespresso machine. The beds were perfectly soft/firm, the sheets high count cotton. Staff was attentive and efficient, handled everything. The Cerrulean Tower is five minutes walk from Shibuya station, and then on to anywhere in Tokyo. Shibuya itself has young energy, and as good a neighborhood as any to stay in to experience Tokyo. The Cerrulean Tower is the first stop on the bus from Haneda, and the last stop on the way to Haneda. Very convenient. We had skis, ski bags, and luggage, and the staff handled them all effortlessly. We had a perfect five days in Tokyo, with a day trip to Kyoto. Would stay here again. Great hotel.

Great location and great facilities. However, there was lack of customer service and personal touch compared to other hotels we stayed at during our trip.We stayed here for seven days over New Years. I can’t complain about the location as it was perfect! The gym was great and the room did its job as we were on tours and on the go.The customer service needs to improve. There was limited recognition from front office staff apart from the bell boy. Front desk did not help or failed to show any willingness to help. I was also annoyed with the access to gym facilities and the additional charge. However, after complaining and to managements credit they provided me with free access after joining their members program.Major improvement areas include: 1) more personalised customer service and demonstrate a willingness to go above and beyond; 2) build fitness facility rates into room charge. Costs are predominantly fixed and opex is a part of performing the service.Hope to visit again soon.

We had a small issue, but it was like the entire hotel came to help and to apologize.The rest was excellent, even by Japanese standards.Incredibly useful the free smartphone they gave us for free avoiding us the terrible cost of roaming

We booked a King room at the Cerulean for five nights in December for a short food and shopping getaway. The location is perfect, just five minutes' walk from Shibuya station, from which direct trains connect tourists to almost anywhere they would want to go in Tokyo. The room was large (not just for Tokyo standards, but legitly large) and had a direct view of Mount Fuji. The small walk-in wardrobe was useful for storing parcels and such from our online purchases. Snacks and drinks can be had at the 7-Eleven downstairs -- not easy to find as it isn't on the street level, but up an escalator.We made good use of the direct limousine bus from/to Narita. When we checked out, we simply called the porter to pick up our bags from our room. She took care of everything and the next time we saw the bags again was at the airport -- very handy. Speaking of bags, if you have a Rimowa, the hotel is one of a handful in Tokyo that participates in the brand's complimentary repair programme. Rimowa will pick up, fix and return the suitcase for free. We took advantage of this to fix a wonky wheel that we never found the time to attend to back home. (Having said that, we had to speak to three different people before someone knew what we were talking about -- best to head downstairs to the front desk instead of talking to the operator.)The only reason why the hotel did not get five stars is this: two months before the trip, I emailed the concierge a list of restaurants to book for the trip. Someone wrote back to clarify something, then silence. I thought things would have been taken care of, but when I enquired one month prior to the trip, I found out that my request had vanished into a black hole. After some scrambling, we still weren't able to secure a couple of reservations at the desired date/time, which meant that we had to reshuffle our other commitments. No attempt at service recovery and the email I wrote to the manager went unanswered. Pretty poor for a luxury hotel.

Absolutely loved our stay here. We were lucky enough to get a quite high room and had views of the whole city. Great location and easy access to the tubes. Would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay again!

This place was easy to find being 5 minutes walk from the station. (There’s a couple of YouTube vids that show u how to get from Shibuya Station to the hotel) The rooms were nice and the staff pleasant. 5 minutes to lots of nice restaurants and plenty of shops.

My girlfriend and I had such an awesome experience while staying at this hotel. Our room was massive compared to all the other rooms we had in Japan, and we had such an awesome view of the Tokyo Tower and Shibuya crossing. We paid extra to gain access to the executive lounge where the breakfast was not the best but the staff and the view of Mount Fuji made up for the breakfast. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to ensure that you had an amazing experience. Best hotel I have stayed at, was so sad to leave but will definitely make sure to visit this hotel in the near future.

The room was spacious among Tokyo Hotels. the staffs speak english very well and definitely very helpful.We love the location, its 5 minutes walking distance to Shibuya Station and it has confectionary store in 2nd floor. so it is absolutely very convenient.Thanks for all the staffs for being kind to our children. they said all the staffs are very kind.see you soon, definitely will come back

We stayed in a Japanese suite which was fantastic. They provide a cell phone free of charge with google maps e t c. Breakfast is very good, although coffee service is very slow for some reason - we stayed 3 nights and every morning was the same. Also wifi is free but extremely slow. Lobby, room or lounge all the same!

My family stayed at the Cerulean Tower over Christmas of 2017, and it was a wonderful choice. The rooms are serene and quiet, with beautiful views of the city. The staff is extremely helpful, and the breakfast buffet is a treat! It was an ideal home base for exploring this amazing city, with many attractions nearby and others a convenient subway or taxi ride away. There is a very large pool for lap swim, too. I highly recommend this hotel!

I have tried other hotels in Tokyo and the Cerulean is the best for many reasons.The Location in Shibuya is so central, you can’t get better than that. Price so reasonable for a 5 stars hotel. The staff is great, room very large, view beautiful, facilities in the bathroom, they think of everything. The lobby is always busy, the cafe is quiet, the patisserie is fantastic!

This hotel is perfectly located - very close to Shibuya station and shopping. Rooms are great, clean with great views. Only complaint is that check in was slow as rooms were not ready. Really good value and bar has amazing views to end the day.

We stayed at the Cerulean tower for a week and the experience was just perfect!The location is great, the front desk staff and concierge very kind and helpful.Our room was large, comfortable and with a great Fuji Mountain View.The breakfast and room service are a bit pricy but the rest was outstanding.Oh and of course the phone we received in the room for data use - WOW! Super helpful.

This hotel was in a prime location in walking distance to Shibuya Train Station, and the famous Shibuya crossing. We stayed on the 23rd floor and had beautiful views of the mountains and the city! The room was very clean, spacious, and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was well supplied with toiletries in case you forgot your toothbrush! I took one star off because on the day of our check-in our rooms were not available earlier as promised. We checked in our bags and wandered the city until check-in time. We would have preferred to check-in earlier as we were tired from our flights. Also, one of the rooms smelled like smoke even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room :(

This is a very good hotel, rooms are quite large which is what we were looking for. Rooms have picture windows which was pleasant to wake up too in the morning and relaxes one at night. Amenities were complete as expected for this type of hotel, rooms were clean.Check in was average. We stayed twice, first check in was ok - average, second check in was really slow and inefficient. It seemed the staff is quite new and was struggling with the process. Took 30+ minutes to check us in and considering, this is the 2nd time we checked in within a weeks' time. English spoken was ok, but average. I would have expected better front liners for this class of hotel. Seems like the smaller hotels we've stayed in, service was much better which is very ironic. They did keep our luggages for us when we left for a 4 night trip out of Tokyo and were ready for us when we arrived. These guys were efficient.Location was excellent on the quieter side of Shibuya but near train station.

This is a very good hotel. When we checked in we got an upgrade which is always nice. You cannot fault this hotel. The rooms are large and well appointed. The location is great with a short walk to the action in Shibuya. The bus from Handea Airport stops at the hotel which is really convenient. You can also catch the bus straight to the airport from the hotel so no mucking around with taxi's etc. Meals at the hotel are expensive but you would expect this. It is literally a 2 minute walk and you will find 100's of bars/restaurants so no worries there. The only reason l did not give this hotel a 5 star is that it is quite a large hotel and it just felt a bit in personal in my opinion. You never seemed to see the same staff members face twice. The staff by the way were excellent. Very friendly and help full.

We had three king rooms. Standard but wonderful views. Two faced Mount Fuji in the mornings and at sunset. The other faced the Tokyo tower. The place is convenient to Shibuya. It’s a stroll and with my mom on a wheelchair in tow, the place was very PWD friendly and accessible to the malls and lovely places to eat around. There’s a 7-11 right in the hotel as well. Service was flawless including the limousine service to and from the hotel. The amenities are great and housekeeping did a great job. Best of all, it’s a stone’s throw from the Shibuya Station where you can access the trains readily. While my fave is still the Tokyo Station Hotel, the Cerulean is a great find. And I’d recommend it to all!

Stayed at the Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel from 26 December to 2 January 2018. The location is excellent (about 5 min walk from Shibuya Station). The Good:Room size and bathroom size were great. We had a corner room on Level 24. Views of Shibuya and Mt Fuji excellent. Not noisy at all. Given the size of the hotel, this was surprising. Very impressed. Service was great. Lovely staff and very helpful. Usual room inclusions, hair dryer, iron/ironing board, robes etc. Service to courier luggage from the hotel to our next destination. This was very reasonably priced at about $30AU for 2 x large suitcases.The average:Breakfast was a little pricey for what it was. Around $40AU for simple breakfast. The bad:Nothing. It was a great stay. Highly recommend.

The views. The views. The views. Just stunning. A sunset over the city with Mount Fuji at the horizon couldn't have been a better start to the stay. The bathroom products were excellent as was the singing tea kettle. The location is close enough to enjoy Shibuya without being right in the maelstrom. There was a consistent lack of help from the concierges perhaps based on their limited English? I also was unable to get in touch with anyone from the hotel before arriving through their website.

It’s very close to Shibuya Station. Lots of foods and shopping around this hotel. Room size is good. It has it’s own luggage room which is excellent. We got the corner room which has an excellent view to the city and Mt. Fuji.

Great location, excellent service, wonderful view all the way to Mt Fuji, draws an elegant and artistic crowd, we were recommended to stay here by a designer who works for Apple, if that into a picture for you.. Extremely comfortable thank you. Easy walk to Shibuya station. A perfect vantage point to take in this wonderful city.

We moved to Cerulean after spending few days trying to stay at a local residential in Shinjuku area. It was such a great relief as it was actually my husband's treat to move to a proper place to stay and enjoy Tokyo. We loved the spacious room as we were facing Tokyo Tower so we can see the beautiful Tokyo lights with Tokyo Tower in it from where we were at. Loved it!

Shibuya! Beautiful hotel especially the Sakura suite that we picked to stay in! Stayed here with our two kids and they loved it! Service is amazing and I mean amazing! Excuse the endless use if exclamation points but it's how awesome our stay turned out to be at this hotel. Best service and very friendly staff. Food is so good and with such a convenient location, you can just walk walk walk everywhere in Tokyo. Well maybe take the train for the longer distances which is ideal really. Cannot wait to return and stay here again!

We stayed at this beautiful hotel for 4 nights. The service is incredible -staff is friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is very conveniently situated being a short 3 min walk from the metro. The Shibuya area is beautiful and central. We had a great stay!

We stayed for 1 night in an Executive King room and it was a beautiful well appointed room with phenomenal views in 2 directions, a smartphone for use during our stay, etc etc. The hotel is in a great location as Shibuya is a busy interesting area with amazing train and bus transport options. It is all a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Harajuku is one station away for another interesting area. The let down was the Executive Lounge as paying for an Executive King room meant our breakfast was in the Lounge. The Lounge is a lovely offering to sit down with a coffee to plan where you want to go next but it's breakfast was very very limited. A small range of hot and cold items. The morning we were there the sausages and scrambled eggs were lukewarm and when I told the staff they were very happy to know as they went off and microwaved them to heat them back up. I would have expected a better breakfast than that. The staff are all very professional but there is no warmth in the service. Would stay again due to the quality of the rooms and the location but would not pay for an Executive room as would prefer to use my money for paying for a better breakfast.

I’ve been staying in this hotel 2 times in 2017, definitely I would become their regular guest as excellent location, amazing service, especially the front office agent, Mr M. Hihara, he provides professional service, friendly greetings and good English which easy to communicate. All features in the room are tailor made for tourists such as handy phone, very comfortable bed and pillow, the washroom is very spacious. I have a comfort stay in this hotel without any complaints. Furthermore, every time when I called housekeeping for assistance, their staff would take prompt action to follow up. What’s a excellent hotel that I ever been, even better than some high end international branded hotels.

The rooms were large and comfortable by tokyo standard. The king size bed were super large.Limo bus make a stop directly at this hotel.There is a halal restaurant 200m from this hotel and another one across the street around 500m away.Near to shibuya station so easy to get to anywhere.The rooms are clean and housekeeping were excellent.We order room service after clarifying with the staffs on our diet requirements and the food was awesome and fast.Hotel staff help to arrange our luggages to osaka and im impressed by their service.I made an enquiry the day before and when i came down with my luggages the same staff recognise me immediately and have even fill up the form for me. Will not hesitate to book this hotel again the next time.

I stayed here for a convention at the UN University. It was the perfect location, convenient for work and shopping and sightseeing of a night. The service is exceptional , nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were a great size with good amenities and a comfortable bed. The highlight - the windows that framed amazing sunrise and sunset over the city

We had spent a lot of time trying to find the right hotel for us in Tokyo as this was an important trip for me and my partner celebrating 10 years together. I have previously visited Tokyo for work so i knew what to expect with regards to service etc and really wanting a western breakfast :)We ended up booking the executive floor paying a little extra for a lot more. We got room 3413 which was amazing, two beds and a huge bathroom with a view of tokyo from the bathtub! Couldn't have asked for me, loved it stayed 7 nights worth every penny.

My husband & I treated ourselves at Cerulean for the last couple nights of our trip to Japan. We were beyond impressed! Months prior to our arrival, I inquired about the concierge assisting me with making reservations at Sukiyabashi Jiro. The concierge stayed on top of it and was able to get us in! The day of check in, they also were able to store our luggage until our 2pm check in time. Our room on the 35th floor of the executive salon was immaculate! We had an amazing view of the city, Shibuya crossing and we also could see Mt. Fuji!Location was incredibly convenient. Only a 5 minute walk to Shibuya Station (JR trains & Tokyo Metro).The staff, food & service was incredible. Everyone was so polite & kind. Our only regret was not staying at Cerulean Tower longer :)

We loved this hotel for the beautiful room and amazing views. Tokyo is such a modern and fast paced city that you want to be situated in a central location. The hotel staff are super accommodating and speak English which makes everything a bit easier in navigating to restaurants, sights, etc. we stayed at the Royal Park Hotel, another high end hotel for 2 days and we prefer this location. After being out all day, it’s nice to be able to jump in a cab or take the subway back to a tranquil room before heading out for dinner. There are so many great hotels but this is an excellent deal for what you get. The Mark building is a great place for amazing restaurants and just around the corner from the Cerulean Hotel. Definitely will be back!

We loved our stay in this hotel! We had a room on the 34th floor (Executive room) which had access to the Executive lounge. The view from the room was fantastic - could see to Shinjuku, as well as the Shibuya crossing, Tokyo Tower and over towards the Rainbow Bridge! The room was large and comfortable with a separate walk in wardrobe area. The bathroom had a second window also and there was both a bath and shower. The hotel provided a free "Handy" phone which was great. I have never seen this in hotels before but we used it every day! The phone gave you internet access so it was brilliant to take out with you and use google maps to find your way about. Also was handy to look up restaurants in the area etc. We had breakfast in the Executive lounge - there was a good choice of hot and cold food available. Each evening there were free drinks and finger food from 5pm - 7.30pm so it was worthwhile paying the extra for the Executive access. You could see Mount Fuji from the lounge. The hotel is only 5 minutes from Shibuya station where you can get the Yamanote line which will take you to Shinjuku, Tokyo Station etc. Very easy to get around with signposts in English. The hotel staff were lovely - very courteous and helpful - and they could all speak English well. The only small criticism is that we found the room quite hot at night even with the temperature at the lowest we could get it to go. However this did not spoil our enjoyment of the hotel and of Tokyo. We would definitely return to this hotel if back in Tokyo in the future!

Cerulean Tower, high on a hill, is a landmark in bustling Shibuya––that's to say, in the very heart of Tokyo, close to subway and railroads and the famous multidirectional, pedestrian crossroad. It is wonderfully located. I have been staying at the hotel for many years and every time, I cherish the moment I open the door to any of the rooms and find myself staring––through a window as large as the wall––at the most amazing and classic view of Tokyo.The hallways are a little worn out, but still clean and very quiet. The rooms and bathrooms are compact but feel very spacious because of how well designed and outfitted they are. Table, couch, minibar (a tad sparse), water kettle with teas, great l'Occitane toiletries, large TV, automatic blinds and curtains, and everything works. You can get shiatsu massage in the room.There is a fitness center with good equipment, a spa, and a sun-kissed, quiet (indoor) pool, made even more soothing by the fact that it is not over chlorinated. Please note, unless you have a special deal, you might have to pay extra for the fitness center.The restaurants are delicious, the service alert and solicitous. Even though, after at least a decade of at least yearly stays, I still get desperately lost in the Shibuya Station, Cerulean Tower is where I always manage to go home to.

Because three of us were staying together in one room, we wanted a larger than average sized room. This one fit the bill—it’s decently sized by Tokyo standards. There is a large window sill that I loved to sit in and take in the view while eating a snack, having a beer or morning coffee. We were fortunate to get a west facing view, which made for gorgeous sunsets and a stunning view of Mt Fuji on clear days. We never bothered with any of the hotel restaurants as the prices were high and so many inexpensive alternatives are nearby. There’s a 7/11 conbini around the corner where we bought coffee every morning for ¥150 each morning (along with loads of other goodies like breads, cookies, egg sandwiches, and mochi). We bought some beer there to take back to the hotel to drink in our room at much lower prices (and with less smoke) than the hotel bar. There’s also a quick service noodle shop next door that is open early in the morning and into the evenings, maybe 24 hours. For about ¥500, you can get a really satisfying and delicious bowl of soba or udon. I had Japanese curry there one morning for breakfast with a bowl of soba and that was tasty too. Lots of great izakaya very close as well. Bottom line, unless you’re dying for western style breakfast, you can spend a lot less than the hotel restaurant without going any farther away. The bathroom was lovely with abundant high end amenities like bath salts, special face care kit for ladies, green tea shampoo and more. Of course they provide all of the standard products like brushes and razors as well. The room did smell of smoke, despite being non smoking. There is an air purifier that helped somewhat, although we weren’t certain how to properly operate it as the controls were all in Japanese. The location of the hotel is so convenient to Shibuya station which is a nice place to stay as a home base from which to explore Tokyo. The hotel is a very tall tower, so it is easy to spot when leaving Shibuya station via the west exit. When you’re jet lagged and trying to orient yourself to navigate to your hotel, this is great. Shinkansen leave from nearby Shinagawa station, which is about 20-30 minutes away via the Yamanote line. Cerulean Tower is a reasonably priced, moderately luxurious hotel with a great location in Tokyo. I’d stay again on a future visit.

Lovely hotel, very modern and in a great location. Staff are incredibly friendly, and will do anything within their means to help (with literally anything). I couldn't recommend this hotel more. Very convenient for getting right into the action, or travelling within Tokyo or outside of Tokyo. Location is great, only a 3 or 4 minute walk right into the center of Shibuya. Rooms are lovely, ours had a fantastic view of the western side of Tokyo. I will be staying here again without a doubt. Essentially the perfect hotel in Tokyo. Cannot think of anything even remotely negative, it was a great stay through and through.
user_name:
Tom G
New York City, New York

review_body: Most times I’m in Tokyo I usually stay in Shibuya and at the Cerulean hotel. I’ve been patronizing this hotel since the early 2000’s and they have always delivered. I really enjoy the morning breakfast buffet and get my daily veggie and fruit cravings. Outside restaurants i find are heavy on the proteins and starches. Sometimes you can get a corner suite as an upgrade. The hotel also has a free shuttle bus that drops you off near the Metro and the heart of Shibuya. Not to far from 109 is a great Okinawan bar that cute and quaint.

Cerulean Hotel served its purpose, we had adjoining rooms on the 21st floor as I had brought my baby and a travel nanny along. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and were large for Tokyo standards. They also had a great view of Tokyo. No complaints there. The hotel is very centrally located in Shibuya, near all the major departmental stores and major train lines. Be aware you are in the heart of Tokyo, so there is hustle and bustle and plenty of people, so if you want something quieter and more relaxing this is not the place.The service was okay but could be warmer, its hard to describe but I guess there could be more smiling? I found the service to be very curt.We also unfortunately had a major fire in the car basement and had to evacuate down 21 flights of stairs, which royally messed up my nanny's knee. At first the announcement was only in Japanese and we had no clue whether to leave. The house maid was also misleading saying we should stay since it was only a car fire. Once I figured out it was a fire fire we high tailed it out of the building. The hotel needs to update its policies to inform its guests in all languages. Since 9/11 and earthquake disasters I don't take evacuation orders lightly. Also there were maybe only two staircases down the exit, I was glad things were orderly but there were times the evacuees were stuck in the stairwell and it was hard not to panic, especially since I was carrying my baby. So there may be a con to staying on the 40th floor if an emergency happens, at the very least be aware where the exits to this building are. And the hotel needs to firm up its disaster and evacuation policies. We got comped for the evacuation but that was an experience

When you stay at a hotel it is more than just the room, in the same way that a restaurant is about more than just the food. Japan is known for its serenity, it’s order, but you can forget about that if you come along to the Cerulean- let’s just say, boot camp is more their style, from the check in staff to the waiters, to the Bar upstairs( with its exorbitant cover charge - even for guests!!), little eye contact, less grace. Will not return.

We received a lovely upgrade and gift since it was my husband's birthday and the room was spectacular with amazing views, a huge bathroom, and very comfortable. Elevators are efficient and lobby personnel were always there to help direct us. Close to many stores and metro station, lots of nightlife, restaurants. Excellent buffet breakfast and blackout curtains for dealing with jet lag napping. So gracious and welcoming and super clean and convenient.

We checked into this hotel late following a night flight into Tokyo and was booked on the pretext that it had a sizeable room, was convenient to the shibuya station and had a great view as we had a young baby. We figured we would be spending more time in the hotel and as such would benefit from a great view of the city. After we were checked in by a very formal and icy receptionist who took my card details for room incidentals. This had the unfortunate result of locking my card down for the rest of the stay, however my wife had her card so further purchases were made on that. When we got to our room, we were initially underwhelmed by our south west facing room. A guide was supplied with the room to suggest what the various epithets of the sky line were and what we should be able to see. Such as the rainbow bridge and Tokyo tower. We unfortunately were too far west facing for Tokyo tower and we would have needed a pair of binoculars or a telescope to see the rainbow bridge. On the plus side we did have a fantastic view of Mount Fuji on the rare days that the sky was completely clear so that was a pay off. Also on a positive note the room came with a complimentary ‘handyphone’ for use around Tokyo, giving us 4g internet access everywhere in the city and which allowed access to google maps and some social media. The family room we had been given was adequate but small though additional storage was located in a side room. The staff were for the most part courteous although there was an issue with some members of staff not speaking English to a competent level and accidentally giving incorrect information which was a pain, especially on the last day when we needed to get the limousine bus back to the airport and was told to wait in the wrong area to board the bus. Luckily we had allowed enough time to compensate for this oversight. The location was fine in a good spot approximately 5 to 10 mins walk from shibuya station. The room was clean and housekeeping did a great job. All in all, not an unpleasant stay just overpriced for what was delivered.

We checked into the hotel and was awe by the room size. The room was bigger than most hotel in Tokyo.However, a disappointing factor of this hotel was the use of fitness club. It was not stated in the booking T&C that there is charges for the hotel guest for the use of the fitness club. (Especially we booked the room direct through the hotel website) This action will be a good for future guest.

As expected, Cerulean Tower did not disappoint. Great location, friendly service, spectacular views and a very comfortable room. Get the buffet breakfast, it’s worth it. Try to ask for a higher floor for views of either Mt Fuji or Shibuya crossing. HIGHLY recommend.
user_name:
BrettP879
San Diego, California, United States

review_body: 5 - 10 minutes from shibuya crossing, mannnn so easy and convenient when you shop alot and you can come back to hotel just to drop them first and off you go to another place. The hotel staff was suppppppperrrrrrr excellent, or maybe its the culture of japanese. I came when there was storm and rains, hotels are generous to borrow their guest as many umbrellas we need ( i came with tour of 30 plus more people). The breakfast was two options, japanese and american, i don’t like the taste in the japanese breakfast. But the american one is fine.

All of the employees can speak and understand english very well. They are also hospitable and approachable. The hotel was excellent because their amenities are complete, they provided comfortable rooms, and spacious bathrooms.. In addition to, the provided meal stub can be converted to either breakfast or lunch.

Our 1st trip to Tokyo & we stayed here which was perfect.Easy walking distance to shibuya & to the train make this an excellent base .The hotel itself has everything you need from great restaurants to an amazing bar on the 40th floor overlooking the city.Our room was on the tower floor (floor 37 ) with views over shibuya crossing which was amazing to watch especially at night. The staff were excellent & the service at each place we visited to eat or drink was outstanding. Special mention for Daichi Abe at the front desk who was very helpful in giving me access to the gym after checkout due to my very late flight out .I would def.stay here again & recommend this hotel to anyone going to Tokyo.

Nice large room, very clean and quiet. Though we didn't make a choice, some rooms have views of Mt Fuji whilst ours overlooked Shibuya and across to Shinjuku. Only downside was that the minimum temperature on the air-conditioning thermostat was 20C, a bit warm over-night for some of us Northern Europeans. The hotel must have been aware of this as a supplementary A/C unit had been provided. The concierge arranged for our bags to be delivered to our Osaka hotel, a must if travelling by Shinkansen.

This is truly an excellent hotel set in a great position not far from the train station.Within easy walking distance to various bars and restaurants.Also very close to the world famous Shibuya Crossing and masses of shops.Exceptional service from all the staff a superb place to stay.

Stayed at the Cerulean in the Presidential Suite for my first trip to Tokyo, Arrived early in the morning (6am) and the staff were very helpful in holding our luggage for a couple of hours while they checked us in early for a room. The View on the 32nd floor of the city was breathtaking, and on a clear morning you could see Mt Fuji towering in the horizon. Wifi worked perfect even on the 32nd floor of the building,Staff were very helpful with the train systems, which made the hour long trip to Disneyland an absolute breeze. Over all extremely happy with the spacious room, and Bath, Location and Staff.

A huge building that has several floors as apartments & offices & the rest is he hotel.It's a 5/10 min walk to Shibuya main station & famous junction / shopping area & a 15 min walk to Tokyo Hands department store.If you arrive for breakfast when it's busy be prepared to wait up tp 15mins to be seated which is a bore & very odd, especially as the traditioanl Japanese restaurant on the floor above was empty every time I went.A good size pool & gym for central Tokyo.The room are average size but 'large' for Tokyo.My room was on the 45th floor, lovely for a first time visit to this great city & country.

The cerulean is a Tokyo classic. It’s a little older than many of the hotels you might consider in the category, but the hotel is maintained with a pride and confidence that it’s just right. I only stopped for a night but I enjoyed the warm welcome and amazing location, right in the heart of Shibuya. The views from the room were special and the shower was particularly fantastic. The only downside was that I could only secure a room with two singles, and the pillows are hard (like many Japanese hotels).

The Cerulean Tower hotel is an upscale hotel near the Shibuya station. It is a good walk there as you have to go up across the bridge and then up the hill. Service is good and the rooms have great view of the surrounding area as they are all high up. My only gripe is that even for an expensive room, they made me pay 2000 yen to use the gym. A bit of nickel and dimeing...

We visited the restaurant on the 40+floor The food was exquisite and the views spectacular. This place is 15 minute walk from the main shibuya crossing. They accommodated our dietary requirements and the main course was some of the best fish I have eaten - soaked in butter may have helped! Although we booked a five course meal it felt like alot more - we were in a private dining room but as the restaurant cleared we asked to be moved to the window to enjoy the stunning views whilst consuming our dessert. A lovely dining experience.

I signed up for TripAdvisor just to post this review as my hotel experience was that terrible.I had highly anticipated my stay at Cerulean hotel based on the fact that it was a 5 star hotel and its proximity to Shibuya and all the fun things to do in that area. This was my 3rd trip to Japan, and so far in every experience with restaurants, hotels, taxis, etc I've come to love the country and the friendliness of its people. This is why I've come back here to vacation every year for the last 3 years, as my wife and I have absolutely fallen in love with the culture and its people. Because of this background, this is why my stay at the Cerulean was so shocking and disappointing. Perhaps it was because everyone in our grouped tended to look young or that I had dressed quite casual during my stay there (cause I'm on vacation). But I had never been so rudely treated by a group of hotel staff as a group before in my life, especially at a "5 star hotel" which if that is true, shouldn't just be on the amenities and quality but also due to service.This wasn't just one isolated incident but many. For example, even when we checked in the person at the counter asked us rudely for our passports since I forgot that for international travelers it was required. It echoed the tone I felt throughout our stay there which was slightly condescending and dismissive. We actually stayed in the executive rooms which start on the 33rd or 34th floor so we had access to their special executive lounge where you can get breakfast as wells as snacks/drinks throughout the day. One time when we went up to the lounge for drinks the lady asked us for our room keys to verify we were executive guests in the same slightly condescending manner. Since we had very young kids with us, we wanted to go out and get some dinner and bring it to the lounge to eat at night when the kids were down. When I went to the counter to ask the same lady if that was ok, she reacted in slight horror and said that definitely was not allowed and if we got food we would have to eat it in their lobby. So that's what we did, we got some food and while we were eating in the lobby a hotel worker accosted us and demanded that we leave or go to our rooms to eat. We tried to explain that the whole reason we were eating in the lobby was our kids were sleeping in the hotel rooms and we couldn't eat in the executive lounge. He had literally waved his finger at us aggressvely like a parent disciplining a child and stated in an angry tone that they are a 5 star hotel and don't allow guests to eat in the lobby! I think he thought we had just come in off the street and was a little taken aback that we were actually executive guests because after that he literally scurried away like a rat after we had stated we were executive-level guests and he had no right to treat us that way. By this time we were furious because of the combination of events. The next morning, their front desk manager talked with us and we agreed that we would get a slight upgrade and a 25% discount on our stay. We shook hands and were happy with it and went out for the day. When we returned at 3 pm to move into our new rooms, he then informed us he could not give us the discount although we had agreed to it but he swore he did no such thing. Other hotel workers and my cousin all witnessed him agreeing to the 25% discount. This was incredibly upsetting because we were lied to in our face. Even worse, he claimed to have called Agoda (3rd party which booked tickets) and asked for them to discount us and they refused. When we talked to Agoda, they said they haven't talked to them and offered to give us a full refund on the rest of our stay so we could find other accomodations. I'm pretty sure that the manager never even tried to call and offered us the 25% discount knowing he would later revoke it and making it hard for us to find new accommodations. We ended up moving to the Westin, where we loved our stay.Finally, this hotel is great for business travelers but is NOT a kid-friendly place. We weren't allowed to bring our kids to breakfast, and they charge a ridiculous US $21 a DAY for the pool. We had brought swim wear assuming we could bring them to the pool or at least hang out there even if the kids didn't go in the wate.All in all, this was the most infuriating experiences I've ever had at a hotel. A true 5 star hotel shouldn't feel like it needs to constantly tell its guests they are a 5 star hotel and make the guests feel like prisoners with all their rules. We weren't trying to do anything out of bounds except for eating together and having fun with our kids. I'll never stay again at the Cerulean and will be telling all my friends and colleagues in the future to avoid the hotel at all costs.

This was probably the most disappointed I've ever been in a hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful. It's in a great/central location. Certain staff members were friendly and had some nice perks if you're staying in one of the executive floors, like daily breakfast or happy hour in the private lounge with view. I think I would have mostly enjoyed this if I was there by myself, but I was not alone, I came with my wife and 11 month old and family that also had an infant baby. This hotel should just be upfront and call itself an adult only hotel. It's not on the 3rd party travel sites that you cannot bring children to breakfast. We didn't even realize the gym & pool had a daily charge per person. Then we find out not only there was a charge, but pool is adults only as well. These things just kept adding up, that it felt like its this nice hotel, but we couldn't even use what we were paying a premium on. After being frustrated with all these things piling up, we finally hit our breaking point with the service, or lack thereof. Both us and the family we traveled with had our babies down for bed in our rooms. We went up to have a drink in the executive lounge and asked if we could bring in food since they didn't serve food there. They were appalled we even asked and told us we couldn't do it, but could in the lobby. We went and picked up some food next door and ate in the lobby like they said we could, to then get verbally abused by the lobby workers for eating in their hotel lobby. First, it seemed like they profiled us, thinking we were just rift raft in their 5 star hotel, seeing us being young and in shorts and t-shirts. They pointed their fingers at us and screamed and made us feel like we were scum. We finally let them have it and demanded a refund to let us check out. They seemed embarrassed once they realized we were staying in their premium rooms. Their manager took us out of the lobby to try and keep us from causing a scene and acted like they would take care of us. We spoke to a higher level manager the next day and initially they just offered breakfast passes to another restaurant on lower floor. We still wanted to not bother and just get a refund. They claimed they couldn't because we booked through 3rd party, Agoda. They did act like they wanted to try and make things right though, and after a lot of back and forth, they promised us an executive suite along with a discount in rate. We left for the day, agreed we wouldn't check out, to come back and find that they didn't give us the suite, they just moved us to a corner room that was older and then said they wouldn't honor the discount. They just flat out lied to us and we just wasted a day working with them, dealing with stress of this whole situation, to then have them pull back on what they promised us. They also said they wouldn't refund us if we wanted to leave, so I went and complained to Agoda that we just received the worst customer experience we had ever faced, and Agoda went ahead and refunded us, no problems at all. We still gave the hotel another chance to try and make it right, now that their excuse of not being able to do anything due to being through a 3rd party booking no longer applies, but they still wouldn't honor it. On top of all of this, the manager was downright disrespectful to me. He only agreed to speak to my family member for some reason, and I was the person that booked the rooms for our family while I was there for work. When I tried to speak to him, he flat out ignored what I had to say and even turned his back on me. It was downright the most disrespectful treatment I'd ever experienced. They liked to claim they were a 5 star hotel, but a big reason for getting a 5 star rating is service, and their service was the worst I could have ever imagined. It was such an anomaly as we have found service in Japan to be wonderful. Since it was late in the day, we checked out the next morning and went over to the Westin, which was absolutely wonderful and they catered to families and treated us with true 5 star service from a 5 star hotel. It truly was a shame, as I'll be back for work and my company's Japan office was a short walk from the hotel, but I definitely will never stay here again and would highly urge anyone else with families to avoid as well.
user_name:
SeanW936
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: This place was handpicked for a business trip and it turned out to be the best decision ever. It also helped that they are an Accor partner hotel so I could earn some decent points for my 6D5N stay. PRICE - really expensive and the only reason I could only stay here was because 3 nights out of 5 were borne as business. My total stay was JPY 196,736 (est SGD2,380) and I opted to upgrade to the Tower Floor for another total of JPY36,828 (est SGD450) as the cost would have been almost the same if I add 2x breakfast to the base rate. So my total was about SGD600 per night! That upgrade gave me breakfast and access to the Executive Salon but still, this is one of the most expensive non-suite rooms I have ever stayed in. Note that the rates are a little lower if you book through their website proper instead of the Accor website. LOCATION - right smack in Shibuya and the towering height makes it too hard to miss, plus a good navigating point if you get lost in the area. 5mins-10mins walk from Shibuya station and a quick walk brings you to the middle of the action. GETTING HERE - Super easy after a little research. After getting out of the arrival hall, grab your airport limousine bus tickets from the counter, go to the correct bus stop number (they will check your ticket again), and get on while they load your luggage. Get down when they announce Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel. Must easier than attempting the train! CHECK IN - was super happy the room was already available at 11am+ and process was courteous and seamless. I had also ordered a box of items to be collected upon my arrival and was impressed that the hotel even allows such transactions for the brand (payment was made to hotel upon checkout)ROOM - I got 3302 (twin beds) and the the size was adequate for 2 ladies with big luggage. Cleanliness was top notch, and so as the toiletries offered in the bathroom. L'occitane toiletries was def a bonus! Super comfy beds but the a/c takes a while to get the room comfortable enough. EXECUTIVE SALON - I had access to the Executive Lounge and most times it was never crowded, even at breakfast. Service was always polite and attentive. But the cocktail hours had a poor showing in terms of the quality and quantity offered - pre-packed cheeses and dried fruits, nuts, and cookies but no other cold and hot items. I understand that its not supposed to be dinner food but with the other properties offering much more, its always good to stay competitive. Coffee was good though. Bonus points for champagne available during cocktail hours. I also had a bad breakfast experience one morning but I've corresponded with the management directly so not going to repeat here - essentially about flexibility and offering options to guests. FACILITIES - I paid JPY1,080 (SGD15) to check out their indoor pool, really nice with a adjourning jacuzzi. But I found it really strange to have to pay to use the facilities with a $600 per night room.CHECK OUT - Swift and painless. SERVICE - not too bad except for my crappy breakfast experience. This will be my first choice if I come to Shibuya again but the prices makes it really hard for it to be an easy choice.

This hotel is beautiful and conveniently located to the hot spot of Shibuya with all its lights, shops, places to eat, noise, and future fashion trends! Good value for money with a comfortable room and handing out a free smart phone for the duration is a great amenity.

Recently spent six nights at this hotel. Room was large (especially by Tokyo standards) and comfortable. Fabulous bathroom. Breakfast in the Executive Lounge was magnificent. Also ate several meals in the Caramelo restaurant off the lobby. Breakfast food seems identical in both places but the Exec lounge has a wonderful view and better atmosphere. The view is very good but actually, once you've seen it, it doesn't change from day to day. Was on the 32nd floor. Friend had a corner room on 25th floor for a lower price with better view, but without the electric curtains and window shades. Staff is helpful and gracious. Would stay again.

Cerulean Tower is an excellent hotel in Shibuya! It was the perfect place to wrap up our trip in Japan. Conveniently close to the Shibuya Station with a 5-minute walk. We were also ecstatic when we got a complimentary upgrade to the executive level. Maybe it's because we were staying on a Monday to Wednesday. We didn't get the executive amenities, but we were very happy with our room. The executive room was impeccable. More westernized and larger than any other rooms we had stayed at in Tokyo. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was spacious. The whole room was spotless. And to top it all the city view from the room was awesome. We were able to see the famous Shibuya crossing, and I was so in awe by the city lights. Service was also great. After checking in, we had a bellhop who also gave us a brief tour of our room and showing our amenities. Front desk was also very helpful. One even tried helping us make a dinner reservation. Another one was able to assist us in reserving spots on the airport shuttle for the next day. That was the best decision we ever made. It's much easier than taking the subways to get to the Narita Airport. The bus picked us up at the hotel and took us directly to Narita. It's honestly the best way to travel to and from the airport for families with children too.

Cerulean Tower is very convenient - walking distance from Shibuya subway/JR station which is on the line of the Narita Express or connects to Shinagawa for the Shinkansen bullet trains. The staff were always very helpful. The room was great - spacious and well-designed. We had an the executive king room - on Floor 33 - with lounge "Salon" access - this included an excellent breakfast plus drinks and snacks in the evening and tea/coffee until later. The lounge was a real asset - drinks before going out to dinner or a cup of tea later. We also had a quick meal and later a very good Japanese dinner in the lower price-range restaurant - Caramelo - very good value. Overall a great hotel and we will come back to it next time we are in Tokyo.

I would emphasize good location, meaning centric and close to most known areas and transport hubs, there are also quite many options to choose from for an evening drink & snack in the vicinity. The rooms are simple yet 'all you need' comfortable for business traveller with one plus - great window views.

customer service was amazing, room was great with city views but i recommend upgrading to executive which will be covered by the AMAZING breakfast from the 35th floor with unlimited coffee types, drinks, juices, eggs, veggies, etc which alone would cost 30/person or more- add the 5 o'clock happy hour of snacks and wine/champagne etc and the upgrade is more than paid for and the experience awesome. location of hotel was great with lots within walking distance.

Very modern and clean hotel with great toiletries! We stayed in the family suite which is two adjoining rooms. The room is very spacious and comfortably fit 3 of us in each room. The king size bed is a California King and there was still enough room for my roll away! This hotel is centrally located and is just a short walk to the train station. I mainly decided to stay here because it's one of the stops on the airport limousine bus and I didn't want my elderly parents to have to lug their suitcases around the city.

The best thing about Cerulean is the location. It's a brief walk to the subway and shopping/dining areas. Although this hotel was touted as a family hotel, it felt more suited for business travel. Service from staff was efficient and professional, but somewhat impersonal. There are extra costs to use the pool and gym, so I opted not to use the facilities. We ate at the lobby restaurant once for lunch (very good) and once for tea (excellent cakes). Otherwise, there are many nearby eateries. The rooms have great views, and were clean and modern.

The hotel is located ca 10 minutes from Shibuya Station (good enough) and Shibuya Crossing, has modern, spacious rooms and a very decent bar on one of the top floors. Service was naturally impeccable. A very decent place to stay, would recommendOne downside - when we stayed there (1st half of Sep 2017), the fitness area and the pools were closed for renovation. This of course needs to happen every now and then, but we were nonetheless disappointed as we'd chosen Cerulean specifically for the swimming pool factilities....and we learnt about it at checkin (not when we were making the reservation). I hope the facilities are stellar once the upgrade is done.

We stayed several nights at this hotel as part of our tour of Japan. The location of the hotel is excellent, it is approximately 5 minutes walk from Shibuya station, which made it very easy for us to travel around the city using the yamanote line. Our room wasn't ready when we first arrived but the hotel stored our luggage for us whilst we explored Shibuya. It was worth the wait - the view from our room was absolutely stunning, overlooking some of Tokyo's sights including Shibuya crossing and Tokyo Skytree. At night the view was even more spectacular! The room was an excellent size and spotlessly clean, with a generous supply of toiletries and bottled water. Despite being in the centre of Shibuya, there was no traffic noise and we were not disturbed at all by other guests. We didn't eat at the hotel during our stay as we felt there were more reasonably priced alternatives available elsewhere, but there seemed to be a wide range of dining options available. This hotel is a great base for exploring Tokyo. It is worth bearing in mind that consumption tax is added to the final accommodation bill.

Stayed 5 nights. Received an upgrade on check-in. Room on the 34th floor. Quite a view over the city. Loved the room. Large (38sq. meters) by Tokyo standards. Wonderful bathroom with full shower and tub facilities. King-sized bed was very comfortable. TV services had two English channels, CNN and BBC. Breakfast not included in the room price but was well-worth the 3,000 Yen additional charge per person. Hotel restaurants offered quite good food, although the fine dining was a bit pricey. Staff were especially excellent. I'd like to thank the concierge services for helping me retrieve a pair of lost reading glasses from United Airlines. They were also very helpful with planning our daily excursions. The airport transfer (Airport Limousine bus) service was very smooth, on time, and reliable. An easy connection to and from Narita airport. Hotel is just a ten minute walk from Shibuya train and subway station, and the famous "scramble intersection" is also in the same area. Easy to get around, lots of food and shopping and people watching. We're ready for a return trip!

Stayed here with my boyfriend in November after a business trip and i have to say I was impressed. Great restaurants in the hotel and spacious rooms. Many room categories to choose from and not sure which one is on my picture. But safe to say I stay here again

The hotel is located in Shibuya near train station and closed to the famous Shibuya crossing, stores and restaurant.The room is very clean, spacious and updated. Their twin bed was as big as double bed in the US, the amenities were top notch and the service was beyond excellent. They paid attention to every single thing and took care everything during our stay.
