With the room rate you wouldn't expect to pay extra for a bad tasting coffee, we would not have touched it if we weren't too tired to walk to 7 Eleven attached to the hotel and if we'd known it was not complimentary.Overall, would still recommend the hotel when you visit Tokyo, choose the room with sky view.

I've visited Tokyo the last three years and have stayed at Cerulean each time, the most recent in July 2016 with my family (two kids under 10 and my wife). First, the location is excellent, under a 5m walk to Shibuya station (JR) and walkable to Harajuku if you don't mind 15-20m. Of course, Shibuya has tons of shopping and restaurants as well.The hotel is modern, very clean, with large bathrooms, especially for JP/EU standards. The beds are smaller than US size but fine. Staff speaks English and is super helpful. The concierge can help with tickets, reservations, transportation, etc. There's also a 7-11 convenience store attached to the building (though you have to go outside up the escalator) which is nice.Note that kids 11 and under are "free", meaning if they share a bed with there is no charge - i.e. you can have 2 adults and 2 kids in a double room (essentially two double beds). The beds are smaller than US (not Queen size!) - should be fine for the average US 8 year old or under but bigger kids and adults will be cramped.The hotel caters more towards professionals but I'd come back with my family. It can be one of the pricier options but I've always been able to book rooms between $275-$325 a night.

I lived in Tokyo for several years and I choose to stay at this hotel for its convenient location. Next to Shibuya main station and close to all the interesting shopping areas. The hotel is quite big and convenient because also the limousine bus from the airport has a stop there. I was expecting a little more friendliness from the staff.
user_name:
Renato28
New York City, New York

review_body: I was able to leave my luggage before checking in as I was going to Kyoto first and come back in 5 days and I didn't want to take all my luggage, so they stored my bags for free. I reserved a room at the highest floors and the view is wonderful. I recommend this hotel it is very close to Shibuya station and you can go directly to the airport from here by bus, the staff will help you with reserving the tickets for going to the airport and other services.
user_name:
mapilar168
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The pleasant experience started even before our trip. Their Room Reservations Dept. provides prompt response to my enquiry and their website is very comprehensive. Since we went to Karuizawa before we arrived Tokyo, I enquire about the transfer on JR. And it turned out to be quite convenient with the information they provided.Upon arrival, we are efficiently checked in and we have the whole late afternoon and the evening to spend.Room size is decent with enough space to move around with the 3 of us. We are a family with older children. There are a lot of coffee house, noodle shops, convenient stores... in the vicinity, so we didn't have breakfast at the hotel while we stayed.It's convenient to move around Tokyo from Shibuya. The hotel is strategically located, immediately above the airport bus stop which is also the last stop before getting to Terminal 2 of Narita International Airport. If you are not buying a return ticket of N'EX or haven't arranged anything, it's a bargain to jump on the airport bus. One-way ticket is only 3,100 Yen (adult).It's also very close (5-minute walk) to JR and Tokyo Metro stations. Absolutely no complain at all in every aspect. If you are look for luxury at a reasonably affordable price. THIS IS IT.We are sure to stay again here on our next visit to Tokyo.

Obviously the hotel has good location and other things we love from the hotel were spacious room, very good amenities, great view from the room and most loved of all.. soaking away all the soreness from walking, next to the panoramic bathub window...

If you want a luxury place to stay at an "affordable" price for a family of 4, this is it. I spoke with travel agents who pushed me to choose Keio Plaza or similar hotels and get 2 adjoining rooms. The Sakura suite at cerulean was going to cost more than 2 rooms at Keio. But it was worth it and cost effective. First of all, the kids loved sleeping on futons on the tatami mats every night. The beds were very comfortable. The area was cleaned and changed into a sitting area with a low table every day. The "king" sized bed could fit 4 people. The pillows and bed were so comfortable. This is from a pillow snob. My only one high maintenance thing. There is a ton of closet space. The bathroom is amazing- soaking tub for one and shower and of course, the famous high tech toilet. The bath products are L'Occitane. They provide you with toothbrush, razor, hairbrush and more. The outlets accommodate us plugs. The Sakura suite gives you access to club level. So here's the cost analysis: we saved money on breakfast included- not just any breakfast but 4 choices of great breakfast. Choose from buffet which has American and Japanese choices and fresh squeezed orange juice and Nespresso coffee (a favorite), Japanese breakfast at Japanese restaurant ( ceramic bento box tower with soup), club level room buffet or room service. We got 4 bottled waters free every day which was useful for the amount of walking we did. For some of the days, we used the cocktail hour at club level to have a light dinner with Chivas for my hubby. The fitness center/pool was free for us ( only able to use if 18 or over so not for our teens). These amenities saved us hundreds of dollars and made it similar in price but a much nicer room. This goes in the top 3 hotels we have ever stayed at and that keeps company with the St Regis, Four seasons and Ritz. It's worth it. Did I mention the view. Amazing view of Tokyo from our room and club level lounge. Location was easy for travel. Take JR train Yamanote line to Shibuya and exit from south gate (west exit). You walk across pedestrian bridge straight then right ( make diagonal to go across). Don't take New south exit. It was fine with luggage from Narita Express. We each packed carry on bag and a backpack. We packed quick dry clothes and rinsed our clothes out with powder detergent I packed. The bridge has ramp in center so easy to pull bags up. We are fit and used to traveling so it was not bad. But easier would be to take airport shuttle which would drop you to the front of the hotel. I would recommend this if you have bigger bags. Service was great and very friendly staff which keeps place impeccably clean. They will loan umbrellas but we packed small travel ones which I found easier than lugging big ones. 7/11 is on site and can be used to get money from atm. We would definitely stay here again. As an FYI, we went to the Keio plaza for a tour meeting point. Keio is Not the same caliber on how luxurious it looked and much bigger touristy place. This is not to knock Keio. I didn't stay there and it looks like a nice hotel but Cerulean is really first class.

My brother and I stayed here for one week. I had a very comfortable room with an amazing view. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. I had to check-in very late because of my flight arrival time. I contacted the hotel by e-mail and received a friendly reply right away letting me know that my late check-in was OK. They also helped me arrange ground transportation around Tokyo.

Staying here for 2 nights with my husband and loving it so far. Our room on the 30th floor has an incredible view of the city. The room itself is modern, spacious and spa-like with a deep tub, separate shower, cozy robes and slippers, plush pillows that have a cushiony side and a rice/bean side, and long sofa for lounging. Upon entering, the room was quite warm but there's a standalone a/c that fixed that. All the buttons are in Japanese characters but we figured out what worked through trial and error. The staff are all very polite and friendly and speak English. Love the Japanese toilet with bidet/splash/sound features. There are several restaurants and a 7-11 on site. Tried the fitness gym and pool/jacuzzi today. You should definitely check it out. It was practically empty and I got to enjoy their many up-to-date exercise machines, their massage chairs (they have 2), their shallow lap pool with perfectly lukewarm water, and the heated jacuzzi. The pool and jacuzzi offer a view of the city from the 3rd floor. There is a powder room with lots of toiletries, several private showers with Shiseido shower gel, shampoo and conditioner, and a sauna. There are also lockers for your valuables and clothes. A bracelet with a locker key is furnished upon entering the fitness gym. They offer swim caps for the pool to keep the water fresh. Upon entering the pool section, you enter a short hall where a shower automatically rinses you off. I showered ahead of time and bypassed the extra shower by just walking fast. The fitness room also has a blood pressure machine, water fountain, beverage vending machine, and lots of large and small towels. I just brought the complimentary water bottle from our room and kept refilling it at the water dispenser in the ladies room, as needed. The hotel is conveniently located near (less than 5 minutes walk) to Shibuya Station and the famous Shibuya intersection. Nearby are also several restaurants, bars and shops.

We stayed for 4 nights. I arrived at 7am expecting to pay an night's fee but they offered me a complimentary early check in which is rare in Japan. The location was fantastic, having to go 5 min or less walking to Shibuya crossing and all the major transport be it bus, Metro or JR. The cleaning was just impeccable - the best I have ever seen in all my travel. I would stay here again next time I visit Tokyo.

My family of three booked a triple room here for 5 nights. While the rate was not cheap, it was probably fair for Japan standards and the room is so spacious and could fit 3 good sized single beds! We were in Room 2106. View was not the greatest but got better in the distance! Toilet was big and had a separate shower room with bathtub. Bed & pillows were super comfy and room very clean. We loved it. Location to Shibuya train station is close and very convenient. And there is a Family Mart just around the corner if you need anything. Lots of shopping and eateries in the area. Staff were very polite and friendly. The Haneda or Narita airport limousine buses stop here so thats a plus! My only small complaint would be that no complimentary water/coffee/tea was made available to us in the room. And breakfast is not included in the room rate and for us, I felt it was not worth the additional high cost of having the breakfast. We had great coffee and snacks from Family Mart before setting everyday. Better spend your YEN on good lunches & dinners!

Cerulean has an amazing staff who are helpful and easy to communicate with. The rooms were very spacious even for triple share, this was definitely a plus for us especially considering how small rooms can be in Tokyo. Breakfast can be so-so, but dinner at Chin (Szechwan Restaurant) and Caramelo were such a treat!Location wise, it's less than 10 mins walk to Shibuya JR Station. It's also walking distance from Daikanyama (took me about 15-20 minutes). If you're a coffee lover, I would highly suggest trying out 'About Life Coffee' and 'FabCafe' just across the bridge (less than 10 mins walk).The only odd thing is that Fitness facility is only free from 6-7 am (1 hour only). So be mindful of that if you intend on hitting the gym.

First time in Japan and Asia although we have traveled a lot in EU. I was expecting that the trip would be a bit of a challenge due to the culture and language differences. The Cerulean Tower was our first real contact within Tokyo and they couldn't have been a better ambassador. The room was quite comfortable, the northern view upon the Shibuya neighborhood and Yoyogi Park was beautiful, a good vantage point to the area and the staff couldn't be more perfect. The staff was engaged, cheerful, attentive, helpful and respectful to guests. The hotel has a lot to offer in terms of restaurants, bars, fitness centers that we just scratched the surface of. Our stay in Tokyo was amazing and too short. The deep bows to our bus when we were leaving the hotel and Tokyo left us feeling appreciated as guests and looking forward to our return in the future.

Stayed here for 3 nights. Love the location of this hotel. Just minutes to the famous Shibuya crossing with plenty of food options. Rooms are sizeable big given real estate in Tokyo. Staff are proficient , friendly and most helpful. Will stay here again.

Stayed in the 33rd floor with great views of Tokyo ......had access to the Executive Lounge for Breakfast and Pre dinner Drinks / Coffee / Snacks etc .Modern hotel with all the bells and whistles .Staff very knowledgeable and efficient with respectful serviceConcierge was very helpful in all recommendations - trains , restuarants , shops etcGood location 5min walk to Shibuya station and the ShibuyaScramble.Only drawback it was a bit pricey ....

Had a great stay here. Service in Japan is usually very good but often focuses on the polite rather than the friendly. This place strikes a nice balance. Great but expensive bar on the top floor, spacious rooms by Japanese standards. We had breakfast included in the executive lounge, and it was a worthwhile indulgence- plus included free pre-dinner drinks. Breakfast choice was good but not huge. Overall highly recommended for a luxury stay in Tokyo. Was also nice to experience a Japanese luxury hotel rather than an American chain.
user_name:
Graham C
St. Albans, United Kingdom

review_body: My kids and I spent 5 nights in this hotel. Let me start by saying that the location of this hotel is very convenience. it is located near the Shibuya metro station and one of the stops of the Narita Express. We stay in one of the rooms at the 20th floor and the view of tokyio is breathtaking. the rom was alsoe very spacious and clean. The bathroom is huge and have all the amenities of a 5 star hotel. The personnel is extremely polite and provide good service. Definitely I will comeback to this hotel
user_name:
Manuel C
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel provides an amazing level of service for the price, the convenience, and the great personal service. In the past three years I always stay here whenever I visit our country office in Shibuya. The airport limo service from Narita has a direct first stop here which is so comfortable and cheap at JPY 3,100. The hotel is very convenient and easily accessible to all the nice places in Shibuya. I highly recommend this hotel for business travellers and families on vacation. The General Manager of the hotel even makes sure there's a welcome treat for me in the form of fruits or pastries whenever I check-in. Really awesome service!

Our stay at Cerulean Tower was lovely.Our room (number 2002) was very comfortable, spacious and clean.Pro's:- Excellent location (close to train station and shops)- Room is very clean and well stocked.- Gym facilities are good and clean (free from 6-7am).- No extra fees.Cons:- Internet was very slow and patchy.Overall our stay was excellent. Convenient location (close to shops and train station) would definitely stay again!

extremely helpful and courteous staff. stayed on the executive floor. very well located. quiet. great views. clean room. full service building. ground floor restaurant is very pleasant as well. highly recommended
user_name:
Hernando D
New York City, New York

review_body: Great Hotel Very close to Shibuya Station. Very clean. Good size rooms. Very helpful staff. Always available to help. Concierge very helpful. Staff friendly. Would recommend for reasonably priced hotel with good location.

This is a huge hotel in a good locations right next to Shibuya Station. It is more of a western style hotel if that's what you're looking for. Wonderful views. Huge rooms for Tokyo. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again if you need to be in this area.

We used this very comfortable base to pivot to Shinjuku.Rooms are spacious, well kept and big rooms. As it was summer the sun rose at 4:30am, we would not know as the rooms were pitch black. Wifi was great, room could be cooled to 20 degrees no lower, well kept hotel. You may even catch a glimpse of a Japanese hotel

Firstly, the location of the hotel is wonderful, just a short walk away from the West exit of the station and you definitely can't miss the hotel given how tall the building is. Check in was very smooth and we were allowed an early check in and upgraded to a corner room. The rooms are extremely spacious for a Tokyo hotel with a large sitting area. The bathroom was huge with a view of Tokyo from the bathtub, although we used the separate shower instead. Many amenities were provided - cotton set, hairbrush, razors, bath salts, pyjamas. However, there was no free bottled water. Room was very clean and beds were very comfortable. Wifi was extremely fast. Newspapers are provided in the morning. Would definitely stay here again when I return to Tokyo!

My wife and I stayed at the Cerulean Tower on 2 distinct occasions.All throughout we experienced stellar service, ranging from hard-to-get restaurant reservations to impeccable room service.Location worked out perfectly since it is right next to the Shibuya transportation hub.We took advantage of the airport limousine bus which made our commute in and out of the city a breeze.While on the pricier side, the hotel made our stay relaxing and memorable. I would certainly come back next time around!

It was merely a short 5 minutes walk across Shibuya Station, after the pedesterian overhead bridge, and we immediately saw the tall mighty looking building. We received overwhelming hospitality from the staffs onsite (from the bellboy, concierge, and the duty manager). We kindly requested for room on a higher floor and she gave us a complimentary upgrade to a suite on the corner of 21st floor. Once we entered the room, the room is indeed luxurious and huge (as compared to other hotel rooms in Japan). Awesome view on both side of the windows (2 in the main room, 1 in the huge toilet)! We loved soaking in the bathtub with such a great view of the skyline overlooking the city. Soft and comfortable bed! Housekeeping is great too - gave me complimentary cosmetics set for ladies. We couldn't asked for a better accommodation for our short stay in this lovely city! Oh, and there's a user-friendly kettle for guests to use as well! I have been to some hotels in Japan that didn't have this useful item. Well-rested stay, cosy room, excellent service! Thank you for such a wonderful memory for the both my fiance and myself!

Started our honeymoon off right by staying at the cerulean. It's a gorgeous hotel. Very spacious rooms. The staff was so nice. The location is what sets this hotel apart. It's perfectly located in Shibuya. You can walk from the hotel to all the best stuff in Shibuya, go to the subway stop right there, and then from there to anywhere in Tokyo. It's a dope hotel. Stay there!

Stayed with a group of friends so were able to split some costs and it was worth it. The views are amazing. The staff are fairly friendly, we had a couple of rude ones which is strange in Tokyo.Very modern hotel and rooms. we weren't allowed to use the gym because it wasn't part of the package??? very strange.spacious rooms and a great location. just a short walk to the famous crossing and all the action.

This is a very professional operation with proper large rooms and lovely staff. Location rocks and OMG the views!I woulda given this 4.5 stars really, but maybe not quite 5. I mean it was awesome but lacked a bit of life and I could smell smoke in the hallway. We were on the 26th floor and there was a bath in room 2607 which looked out over the city.

Clean and spacious room with a very comfortable (and huge) bed and a nice view on Tokyo, especially by night.Several restaurants are located within the hotel low levels + a bar at the top level with a sky view.

I received a hotel upgrade and am so thankful, my room had a walk in wardrobe and two giant Windows with a view of the famous Tokyo Tower. Two free bottles of water every day. Water pressure is amazing and hot water comes almost instantly! LOVE!

We stayed here for a few nights and I would happily go back. The room was clean, comfortable, and had great views of the skyline. The location is great. It's a short walk from the west exit at Shibuya station (Yamanote line). You will have to go over some pedestrian bridges, but it wasn't too bad. Overall, the staff members were friendly and helpful. The concierge was particularly helpful in securing a dinner reservation for us.
user_name:
sammyct2
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Perfect location, just in front of Shibuya crossing. Nice swimming pool (18 mt long), gym is ok but only four tapis roulant and a few cyclettes. Very good japanese restaurant: Kanetanaka-so. Try Hazuki menu.

We moved to this hotel at the last minute and found it reasonable for the fantastic views of the Shibuya crossing and Tokyo. Relaxing city views from afar and yet in the heart of Tokyo. Easy access to the Narita express and by foot to Shibuya and Harijuku.

This hotel was upscale in every way...from accommodations, to common areas and helpful staff. Walking distance to the JR station and tons of shops and restaurants. We spent 2 nights here and would return.If I compare it to the states, this would be a 5 star hotel but we paid 3/4 star pricing and it's not their low season.The one comment that usually applies to the upscale hotel , US or abroad, is a hefty fee for using the pool area. It would have been so great to hit the hot tub before bed but $21 per person was more for that fun than we felt was reasonable.All that being said, I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again. But after traversing Japan for the last 2 weeks, I believe it would be difficult to find most hotels anything but clean and accommodating so keep your budget in mind and don't worry that something might be ok...it just might not have the grand common areas or in house services.

I enjoyed everything about staying at this hotel. I was on business, and everything I needed was provided: an uncrowded pool set up for lap-swimming; a great view from the 16th floor; well laid out room; nice shower and bathtub (I love to take a tub on business trips). The bed was amazing, and there were multiple different pillow types ON the bed - a foam, feather, body pillow, and my absolute favorite, the barley filled pillow. The breakfast buffet offered many fresh low-carb options, as well as made-to-order omelettes. The coffee - the regular old drip coffee - was rich and delicious. The bar at the top of the hotel (40th floor) provided an amazing view over the famous Shibuya intersection and we ate delicious white fish and Prosecco, while creating timelapses of the amazing lights and foot traffic in that area. Wonderful.The ONLY downside is cigarette smoke which is allowed in restaurants and bars. Be prepared to smell like an ashtray. But that's anywhere in Japan (most of Asia for that matter).A great location, with busses, subway and anything you want close by. A fantastic hotel!

Hotel was well situated, only a short walk from Shibuya Station. Stayed twice, and both times rooms were spotlessly clean when checking in, and cleaned daily to the same high standards. Staff were very helpful in requests to booking restaurants, even when still in London. Would stay again.

The Cerulean tower hotel is situated in the Shibuya quarter in Tokyo. It is a 40 floors hotel very convinient the rooms are very comfortable and the stuff is very helpful. They serve a rich breakfast and it has a very good restaurant located at the 40th floor with amazing view of the city as well as great food. It is also equipped with fitness club and a large seeming pool ( although it cost money..)

I would definitely AVOID this hotel. The decor dated and unsanitary. I am very unhappy about the sanitation at the Cerulean Tower Tokyo hotel. Not only did I get several bed bug bites after one night stay, but I also got diarrhea from ordering room service at your hotel.

I was upgraded to a Japanese Suite, which was a really beautiful room with all Japanese classic style. Pool and gym was good, but the only disadvantage was that you have to pay for using them separate on daily basis.Location is great. Only 2 min walk to Shibuya metro station.
user_name:
ar_alhosani
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: We enjoyed a great view from our corner room. Hotel staff provided excellent customer service and rooms were supplied with top notch amenities. Its very conveniently located, we had a very enjoyable stay.

In the heart of Shibuya - ideal location for touring the area walking Amazing views from my roomComfortable bed although come as 2 singles Tried breakfast buffet and in room: both perfect Impeccable service

Everything you would expect from a hotel of this class. Spacious rooms, every amenity, good wifi and an excellent cafe with some delicious cakes. Ideally located close to Shibuya stationThe view from the upper floors is amazing. Especially at night.Would definitely stay again.

We had a wonderful 6 days. Complete comfort. The room was fantastic and the staff were amazing from room service to especially the Concierge who went out of her way to assist us. We will definitely be back.

I stayed at the Hotel for the Second time for my Business trip to Tokyo.I found the rooms to be more spacious than the other Hotels that I stayed in the same area and that's a big Positive. This place is about 5-7 minutes walk from the main Subway station and that's not very bad. Being close to the main Shibuya crossing and other attractions is a big advantage. The service at this Hotel is kind of OK and the only thing they can improve is the time it takes to check into the Hotel and also Checkout. The staff is polite and will help you with any query that you have in English Language. I wish they have some water/beverage/snack dispensing machines at each floor as the in room or restaurants at the Hotel are very expensive and it will help travelers to get a soda or a small snack at odd hours. They did not have complimentary breakfast in the room tariff something that we expect in the business hotels.It would also help if there is good signage on how to get to the main lobby once you get down from the Airport shuttle at the Cerulean towers.The View from the Hotel room is awesome and it will amaze anyone looking at the transport infrastructure built around this place.

The hotel and the staff were just fantastic. The hotel was very central, close to the department stores and train station. Walking distance to many tourist & local sights.We would definitely go back to this hotel next time were in Tokyo

Tucked at the corner of Shibuya, the serenity of this hotel doesn't feel like you are placed in the hustle and bustle of Shibuya. It is conveniently close to the train station, about 5 mins walk away. I can't stop raving at how spacious and large the rooms were considering this was in Tokyo. In addition, the airport limousine bus drops you right at the doorstep of the hotel. Unfortunately, the service was not very friendly and the staff seem too busy to help with directions and restaurant reservations. I highly recommend this hotel for families due to its awesome location and large rooms.

I think the location was overrated since the walk to the subway was a not so easy 10 mins long given the construction going around it. Our check-in was not very pleasant as the front desk lady was not so nice. Overall, the service was really poor. The food at the hotel was also quite average. The rooms were small but the view was to die for.

I was staying in Hilton in my Tokyo trip last time and found it was not convenient. So I decided to try another hotel for this trip.It was nothing to complaint about it but only the bed and pillows were too hard.We asked the concierge to help us reserve table in local restaurant and they even gave us details how to get there while we checked in. What can I say ? It was so touching. I was ill in one night during my stay and hotel helped me call taxi and arrange me to the nearby clinic. Overall I can say for this price, this hotel's service were superb.

Visited Tokyo to enjoy the Sakura season and Cerulean tower was the only 5 stars hotel with a reasonable price (Tokyo hotels can be extremely expensive during this season). Hotel location is good, close to Shibuya crossing and metro station 7 min walk. However, you need to cross a pedestrian bridge every time you decide to use the metro or go to Shibuya. lively and beautiful lobby, rooms were specious and clean, exhausted furniture and amenities are not what someone would expect of a 5 star hotel . No room ventilation (Windows can't be opened) and AC was warm. Room service was not good and concierge were helpful without a smile (which is really awkward in Tokyo). Bathroom was really nice with bath tube and a great water pressure for the shower room. Breakfast was a disappointment, cold pancake and limited options (They offer a la cart as well).Chick-in and chick-out were fast and smooth and bell service was excellent.TV was off all the time coz there was no English channel or maybe I couldn't manage to find them! very complicated and many buttons to press!This hotel needs some update.
user_name:
Sultan A
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Nice hotel, excellent service and facilities, great swimming pool. However we had two major disappointments: breakfast doesn't offer sufficient diversity and quality (and we tried both the main buffet and the executive lounge), for the price this is barely acceptable. The executive lounge is quite and nice but while they announce closing at 21.00 which is already early enough, they clean everything away as from 20.30 where the only thing you can find is tea.... And the fitness is ok but doesn't have a single cross-training cardio machine.Still a very good hotel well located but could improve a bit.

Location: perfect - Shibuya Station (West exit), very close to Hachiko statue, restaurants and convenience stores.Room: Excelent - huge king size bed, lots of blankets, pillows and stuff. Nice bathub with a amazing view of the city.Breakfast: not cheap (Y6000 p person), but worth every cent. Lots of excellent food, fruits, cheese, meat, and everything you might want.Staff - more than helpful, in every possible way (directions, reservations, takyubin).WiFi - free and decent where I stayed (23th and 29th floors)
user_name:
Fernandson666
Sao Caetano do Sul, SP

review_body: Super location for Shibuya shopping few minutes away from Shibuya crossing. Rooms are large and beds too! Clean and comfy with good internet connection.The only thing not to recommend is breakfast - extremely expensive and not worth it. Staff was extremely helpful.

Totally recommended The hotel is excellent , the rooms are spacious, amazing view if you get a high floor (I would ask for a view to Yoyogi park if available - but all directions are nice) - and the location is unbeatable - 2 min walk from Shibuya station and Shibuya crossing - tons of shopping and restaurant.The bar on the 40th floor is awesome !Bottom line - top notch and highly recommended

We stay at Cerulean Tower Executive floor, tyou can get the complimentary bottomless wine / champagne during the cocktail hour atbthe cerulean floor, and yes you can chill and drink with unbeatable city view from the 33rd floor . Inside the room they provide amenities from loccitane *I'm impressed , and the room was huge compare to other hotel in tokyo. the location also very strategic, 5 mins walk from Shibuya Station . All the staff were very friendly, and I definetely will come back!

We chose this hotel this time because we wanted to shop around Shibuya area for just a night and apparently it was rated as one of the best in this area. The hotel is nice if you stay above 30th floors. The room size is spacious .Bathroom is good with Loccitane amenities . Staffs are selectively polite. I am a spoilt traveller who prefers to stay in nice hotel. However, I find that the Japan Hotels do not really cater good breakfast spread as other Asia hotels. We have booked a room with Executive Salon (Club lounge) access. Nothing fanciful and it's not worth the extra comfort.Japanese consume green tea most of the time and the room has green tea which are free to consume BUT coffee is chargeable. Bring your own coffee if you are a coffee addict if not cafes are easily accessible with even convenience stores within 50m.

Whether on business or vacation, this is a great hotel. Very close to Shibuya (accessed via a walkway from the hotel). Great staff, very clean and comfortable. Well appointed rooms. Western breakfast on the ground floor, Japanese breakfast (which was great) on the second floor. Don't miss the 40th floor bar and restaurant. Great selection of drinks/cocktails, and stunning views of the city. Other hotels maybe offer a more peaceful feel, or more top-end luxury, but the fact that you can walk into the heart of Shibuya in five minutes makes the Cerulean an excellent choice.

The place is just fine. easy walking around with many restaurants.The room is very nice overlooking the city at night is very nice.The bathroom is very spacious. there is a space for hangered coats & dresses.

A great hotel with great views, excellent service and easy accessibility. We are really glad we chose to stay there in Shibuya. The hotel is so close to the station, easy to find and get in and out off, which isn't the case with all big hotels in Japan. The staff were friendly and helpful. The roof top bar had excellent views. The rooms clean and tidy. When we go back, we will most certainly stay there again. A rare combination of a nice hotel with excellent accessibility to everything you might want in Tokyo!
user_name:
Andrew M
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed the second time at the Cerulean Tower as it provides a great view over the city from the 30th+ floor, very easy access to public transport and is just in the middle of Shibuya and all its numerous bars, restaurants and shops. The hotel also organizes a very convenient airport shuttle bus service!

Stayed here for one night at the end of our trip. Very centrally located and within 3 min walk of the station. The view from the rooms are spectacular and even more so from the bar on the 40th floor. If I was being fussy I would say that the room wasn't meticulously clean with dust evident on hangers and desk surfaces - but for one night with the views and being centrally located it was fine.

Stayed two nights before traveling to Kyoto. Staff is the best, service the best, the view is the best, and their breakfast is excellent. My family liked this place so much we still are talking about it. Our room had s great view and was so comfortable; it helped us through our jet lag very nicely. The shower and soaking tub was great. Local to explore was perfect. Next time in Japan we will stay for sure!

I stayed in this hotel during a business trip and it was simply excellent. Service is very professional, room was big, view was great and location is excellent. Right in Shibuya, many pubs, restaurants and stores are within walking distance of this hotel, which is a huge bonus in a vast city like Tokyo. For those who want to explore the city, it also means Shibuya station is only 5 mins from the hotel.Overall, I had a very pleasant stay at Cerulean. The only quirk we discovered was in the rooftop bar. They have a beer tap here like I've never seen before: basically it allowed the bartender to add separate beer foam to any beer he'd poured. As a Belgian beer lover, this notion of 'fake foam' was intriguing and insulting at the same time ;-) Other than that though, this hotel was absolutely flawless during our short stay.

Room was small. Despite booking a room that provide a Mt Fuji view, I was given a room where I could only see houses and apartments. Not much room space to place my luggages. Staff (the porter) were being impolite and arrogant (wanting my room no in a hurry when I just entered the hotel). Other than that, location and food are good.

The location of the hotel is the main reason we stayed there, but this hotel has so much more than location. The staff was very friendly and we even got an upgrade because we had to wait 30 minutes for our room to be ready. The view, cleanliness and comfort of the room are great. The size of the room and bathroom are also quite large for Japan. This was our best hotel during our trip, I totally recommand it.

Lots of positives about this hotel, rooms are huge especially by Tokyo standards, lovely decor and bathrooms, staff (as is so typical of Japan) were friendly, efficient and faultless, great views of the city from our room and also from the bar at the top of the hotel, also one of the best things about the hotel is that it is literally next to Shibuya station so you have incredibly easy access to the trains, the only gripe I had during our stay was that our room was a non-smoking room but the room still smelt faintly of smoke, not enough to make it a problem but we could have done without it but otherwise great place to stay in Tokyo

Spent our anniversary week and Hotel made it special. Right from the time we got off the taxi Bell service greeted us and had a smooth checkin.. Location can't be more central with everything in vicinity. Food was okay but there are 100s of options in a short walk. Theres a 711 in the hotel itself. And views from the room was perfect. They even provided us with cake for the anniversary... Little pricey compared to surrounding hotels but you get what you pay for...

We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, in both standard twin room and twin room on executive floor. The rooms are the same size, with the executive floor giving slightly better view, breakfast and complimentary drinks in the evening. Would stay in this hotel again if we visit Tokyo again due to the following:1) really spacious room with sofas, big bathroom and bathtub2) great location, minutes away to Shibuya station, shopping malls and restaurants3) direct airport bus to and fro the hotel

We stayed as a family, taking four rooms, for five nights just after Easter. The rooms were excellent. Large, well furnished. Breakfast was pretty good and the staff were very helpful. Location is good if you don't mind being away from the very centre of Tokyo. The do however do one thing that drives me to distraction. There is a bar on the top floor with good views of Tokyo. Perfect place for an evening drink. However, if you want to sit by the window, even if you are a guest, there is a Yen1000 per head charge for the view. I find this indefensible and incredibly irritating. If the GM reads this, please stop doing this with immediate effect. It is cheap and petty.

Only 3-5 mins walks to Shibuya Station. Walking distance to the shopping areas and places to eat, which open till late at night. The hotel has a corporate looks, and feel outdated. But then the room that we've stayed in, was almost 6x the size of standard guestroom in Tokyo. It also has an comfortable bed in Super King size (which very unusual for hotel in Japan). The hotel also serves a good range of continental breakfast. The Bar at the top level has a good view of the city.

The Cerulean is spotless and it has a great location in Shibuya.It is right in front of a major train station (JR) with connections everywhere in Japan. The hotel itself is well kept, very clean and updated. Beds and pillows are Zen comfortable — We were on the 27th floor and had excellent view of the famous Shibuya crossing and the Tokyo tower. Staff was very professional and the croissants at the lobby restaurant are delicious!

Arrived to this hotel after a 13 hr flight from Chicago with family, and were greeted pleasantly by the staff. Everyone smiles and check in was easy despite the number of people in our party....including kids. Our particular room (for two) was spacious, updated, comfortable, had a king size bed and an amazing view of Tokyo! It is only a couple blocks (5 min walk) the the Shibuya train station. There are numerous restaurants and shops, including a McDonald's and Burger king for the less adventurous. Anyone who has traveled abroad anywhere, knows that plumbing and sometimes rooms can be different than the U.S. In some rooms, the beds were smaller and are more difficult to accommodate more people, such as families, so just be aware. Plumbing was great here! The shower was wonderful!And I now believe every toilet should have a heated seat! Enjoy! Thanks for making our stay so pleasant!

Impeccable hotel, conveniently located close to shopping and famous Shibuya station and crossing. Staff were unfailingly polite, professional, and went above and beyond to be helpful. Rooms were amazing and there were plenty of food options (though pricey) available in the hotel itself. Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend to anyone wanting an upscale experience at a reasonable price.

I stayed in Cerulean Tower for 6 nights, and If I´m back in Tokyo would stay there again. If it’s your 1st stay in Tokyo, stay in Shibuya as it’s very central to explore TokyoPros:3-5 min walk from Shibuya Station (JR and metro)3-5 min walk form bus station to airports (also a stop at the hotel)Big rooms & bathroomQuiet hotelComfortable bedRoof top barFriendly StaffConcierge very helpful with restaurant suggestions and bookings3 min firm Shibuya cross (restaurants, bars, karaoke, nightlife, etc)ConsDid not accept payment in debt card (that´s why I did not give a 5 star)

The hotel located in Shibuya, walking distance from Shibuya station, if you observe signs you will be fine to find your way from the station, also airport limousine is an option. Hotel is very nice, fresh and rooms are spacious. The Japanese hospitality is very much there, we got executive room, which was very modern and had a brilliant view for 36 floor. The main problem we had with the executive lounge was almost non-existent evening cocktail spread, maybe spoilt be e.g. Conrad Singapore or Hongkong, but if someone is calling fist of nuts, chips and tomatoes the evening cocktail this is not the right thing to do. One red, one white wine also do not help. Breakfast served in executive lounge a bit better but not really impressive spread, no eggs station, no additional service. I would rather expect so from this class, and price, of the hotel.

We stayed two nights in this very large hotel. We were upgraded to the 35th executive floor and enjoyed comp buffet elegant breakfast and snacks and drinks till 9 pm in the executive lounge on the floor. The view is amazing. Room was of large size so was the bathroom including large bath and shower with all amenities, including Japanese style night wear, slippers and bathrobe.Kettle with tea and coffee and bottles of mineral water and in drawer safe.only problem we found is that there are not enough electric sockets , only two we could find were the one for the kettle and beside the front door , wish there were ones near the bed.The hotel is in walking distance to Shibuya JR and metro via a bridge, about 8-10 min, with lots of shops and restaurants. Smoking corner located at exit from the second floor, outside so a bit problematic on a rainy day. Many restaurants on site including Noh theatre.The airport limousine bus has a stop at the hotel and tickets can be bought with the porter and billed to your room ,as well as luggage tagged and put on the bus for you- very convenient! The staff is very accommodating and helpful with directions and suggestions.

This was a very good choice for Shibuya and the nearby station. Shops just a bridge walk away and easy to reach Meiji Temple, cam walk within 10 mins.We had a room on 35th floor and view was excellent. Large room, we had 3 in there and lots of space. Very clean and modern. Would recommend and would go back. As others have said, annoying that the gym has to be paid for but wish I had as current hotel has no gym at all.

Good location and it is easy to access JR and Metro station. Airport bus has a stop at the parking area ( for Narita and Haneda airport), I The room size is reasonably big and they have good view. Recommend to take corner room as you can able to see Tokyo Tower and Skytree , even Mt Fuji in a sunny day.The skylounge also a place for enjoying the view as well. Good value, I will come back for this hotel.

We have just checked into this hotel and we are beyond disappointed with both the service and the room. From the very beginning, a few months ago when I booked the room, I emailed the hotel to ask if we could change to a non smoking room or change to one if a cancellation came up. No one ever responded to my email. We then checked in today and of course they are fully booked so no non-smoking rooms are available. The room we have been given is very small, extremely dusty (see photos attached) and quite smelly (due to a smoking level). My husband has asthma and both the dust and smoke affect this condition. We asked to change to another room and after alot of difficulty we got shown another room which is identical to the first one. Same amount of dust and smell. So we were given no choice but to take the first room. My wife used to stay here for many years for work and she says the standard has definitely lowered. This is an extremely expensive room and to say we are disappointed is an understatement. I won't be recommending this hotel or staying here again. Such a shame.

From the moment we arrived we were treated so wonderfully by the staff. We were very early so our room was not ready but we were taken to the fitness room and allowed to shower and change in first class comfort! The view from our room was amazing and the room itself was immaculate and large! Our room allowed for free breakfast buffet which was very good and free drinks in the evening as well whilst enjoying the view. I really loved our stay here a large hotel that still has a personal feeling. Would not stay anywhere else now when back in Tokyo.

I stayed here for three nights and the hotel itself was very nice, the room was big and the location was perfect. The bar on the top floor was also very nice. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again

Great helpful staff except if you ask them for a local breakfast place in which case they shake their head and don't know. Larger than usual room for Tokyo. Location is great for food and parks close by. King bed was plenty comfortable and the shower and bath were very nice. Would stay here again if given same rate which I found using tripAdvisor and was more than half off the usual rate.

Awesome location as it's a short 3-5 minute walk to Shibuya station (which has multiple lines - making it easy to commute to other areas of interest), & an easy walk to the main Shibuya shopping area. Whilst there are other similarly well-located hotels in the Shibuya area, we booked this hotel as the rooms here (all high floors) have a fantastic view of the Tokyo skyline. Albeit the pricey room rates, the quality of our rest/stay (in the comfortably large room) was well worth the money spent. Concierge service was excellent as they helped to secure our restaurant bookings for us a month in advance. We found it very convenient to take the airport limo bus to and from this hotel, as the drop off and pick up point is located at the basement level of the hotel (would highly recommend this vs lugging your own bags to the train station or taking a taxi which can be very expensive. Return fare per person for airport limo bus was ¥4,500 - we purchased this at Narita airport). Breakfast was not part of the room rate - though fortunately there are a few places in the vicinity that are open early for breakfast (e.g. Gontran Cherrier cafe for pastries - just further down from Shibuya Hikarie Dept Store, from 730am; Yoshinoya near the Shibuya Station for local 'don' bowl). There's a 24 hour 7-Eleven convenience store (within the hotel-office complex), which also has some simple breakfast-to-go options & hot coffee.

I was torn between Intercontinental or Shibuya Excel.Since we will be shopping at shibuya and harajuku, then it is best to stay around these area.And also we will be arriving Tokyo from Kyoto via Shinkansen, there is stop at Shinagawa but no harm spend 5-10min to Shibuya/Harajuku.Then Nex train directly Shibuya to Narita Airport T2.Thus, I opted Shibuya area.Shibuya Excel is located at the train station, which seem ideal.Cerulean location is 7min away from train station. (Initally I thought it was complicated to walk to, but no.)Exit from train station, on left side (below the overpass) there is lift. Walk along the overpass, and down via lift, walk 3mins you arrived hotel building. Use esclator, you arrived hotel internal.However, room space and bathroom are also my main concern too.Finally I chose Cerulean for they have bathtub, and Shower area. Which standing to shower is safer for folk.Arrived at hotel, staffs seems readily professional and friendly to assist you.Stayed 21st floor. Twin bed + 1 additional bed. (Note: well-paid for bed instead of getting sofabed)Room was very spacious, enough for 2 big luggages, and walk around. There is sofa as well.Bad point: understood you have to pay for minibar drinks, but no compliementary bottled water.Fortunately, I am particular with bottled water, so I got it from supermarket.

Flying in have a very long flight was tread to fantastic staff that was more than helpful at every turn. From offering helpful advice where to go, to letting us store our luggage for a couple of days as we explored other cities such as Kyoto it was a joy. The room was immaculate and fairly well sized. Room service and breakfast was enjoyable. Location was great as well. Only minor nitpick was the beds were a bit firm .I highly recommend this place for the staff.

We stayed here for 4nights.Room was very clean and wide enough to stay and we had a great view of Tokyo tower :)Location was also great since it's located next to the JR Sibuya station. And there's a shuttle from the hotel lobby so it's very convenient to use an early plane. We'll definitely stay here again.

This hotel is in a great centralized location for working in the Shibuya, Harajuku, Daikanyama or other surrounding areas. Great service and rooms with an excellent morning buffet and staff. Easy access to the hotel from the airport, whether it be train or paid bus limousine service.

Great hotel in a perfect location (albeit you have to use a footbridge if you are walking from Shibuya station). We had a Tower Executive room which was very large and well laid out. Good amenities in the bathroom. Stunning views over the city (towards Tokyo Bay in our room). With this room, you have access to the Executive Lounge on the 35th floor where breakfast, afternoon tea and then cocktails with snacks were served - all included in the room rate. The breakfast was plentiful as were the cocktails. The Lounge was very peaceful with accommodating staff. In fact, lovely staff throughout the hotel. A great stay.

We stayed here for more then a week the room was immaculate with an awesome view over the scramble. The room was very spacious for a Japanese hotel and the bathroom was very generous and a toto toilet is always a pleasant experience the staff service was as expected above and beyond the standard elsewhere loved it. Great central location an easy 3 min walk from the shops and plenty of transport options

This is my first time to stay in this hotel, we travelled in a family of 6(with kids), we need some place convenient and also spacious. We were there around early December 2015, 2 rooms and added extra bed in each room. To my surprise, the rooms are more spacious than I expected. The lobby is decent with high ceiling. One more good thing to point out, the bus stop of airport limousine from Haneda airport is just located at its basement. At first we also hesitate as the price is at high side but we felt worth it after our stay as we really enjoyed it.

Cerulean Tower is located just a foot bridge away from Shibuya Stations. Yes, you need to use a footbridge to get there. Our room was big. so was our bathroom. and they have enough space for our clothes and luggage. We were just surprised that our room has no free coffee and tea. Unlike in most of the hotels that we go to that its free. Here, its not. We did not include breakfast as its a bit expensive. Since convenient stores are in every corner of Japan, we just got our daily coffee and bread from there instead. The pillows in our room were not comfortable. We had 3 kinds - soft-hard and hard & heavy. I should have asked for a replacement but kept on forgetting to do so. Airport bus transfers are available in this hotel, it's Y1,030 per person. Overall, this hotel is in a good location. Clean and hotel staff are always ready to assist you.
